analyzed: ji ltar mig dang rna ba dag gis lus yongs su bsrung ba yin zhe na //

analyzed: 'di dag gi byed pa ni yul 'dzin pa tsam zhig 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of this is that the eye and ear control the arising of their respective consciousnesses because they are the basis that supports the eye and ear consciousnesses.

analyzed: mig gis sgra nyan pa ni ma yin no //

translated: The eye and ear are the uncommon cause of the arising of the eye and ear consciousnesses because they are the basis that supports the eye and ear consciousnesses.üîΩThe nose, tongue, and body control the arising of their respective consciousnesses because they are the uncommon cause of the nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses.

analyzed: 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa yin zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don go bar zad do //

original: gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni //

analyzed: mig dang rna ba dag skye ba'i chos dang lus yongs su bsrung ba la rim pa bzhin dbang byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: The eye and ear are dominant in the generation of consciousness and the protection of the body, respectively.

analyzed: sngar bshad ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni lung ngo //

original: gzhan dag na re gnyi ga yang gnyi ga ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnyi ga yang gnyi ga ste /

original: skyes bu dam pa bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa la dbang byed pas so zhes so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa la dbang byed pas so zhes so //
translated: Because they are dominant conditions for the reliance on holy persons, listening to the true Dharma, and so on.

original: bzhi rnams gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi rnams gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba la /

original: 'dir yang brnan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang brnan pa ste /

analyzed: yul dang yul can grangs mi mnyam pa'i phyir re re zhing yin no zhes bya bar shes so //

analyzed: lo'i sgra ni rnam grangs phyi ma gsal bar byed pa'i don to //
translated: The term and is for the purpose of clarifying the subsequent enumeration.

original: sems can gyi bye brag dang khyad par dag la dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can gyi bye brag dang khyad par dag la dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are dominant conditions for the specific and general characteristics of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams mig la sogs pa dbang po can du mtshungs kyang po'am mo zhes bya ba'i bye brag 'di pho dang mo'i dbang pos byas pa yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar bskal pa dang po pa rnams ni dbang po gnyis 'byung ba'i gong rol tu sems can sems can zhes bya bar bye brag med par rnam par gnas la /
translated: Thus, in the first eon, sentient beings were called sentient beings without distinction prior to the appearance of the two faculties.

analyzed: dbang po gnyis byung nas ni pho'i mo'o zhes bya ba de ltar bye brag tu 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dbang po byung nas nu ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang nga ro dang spyod pa la sogs pa bye brag yod pa de'i phyir / de dag ni sems can @141a * //

analyzed: gyi khyad par la yang dbang byed do //

analyzed: de lta na 'o na sems can gyi khyad par kho na sems can gyi dbye bar 'gyur ro zhe na //

analyzed: gang gi phyir nu ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang nga ro dang spyod pa yod kyang dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan du skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po med na pho 'o mo'o zhes ston par mi 'gyur to //
analyzed: gzhan du skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po med na pho 'o mo'o zhes ston par mi 'gyur to //
translated: If there were no faculty of male or female, one could not indicate a male or female.

original: de'i phyir sems can gyi khyad par sems can gyi dbye ba la dbang byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gyi khyad par sems can gyi dbye ba la dbang byed do //

analyzed: sa tva bhe d'a r++ya bhe da: gzhan dag sems can gyi khyad par ni gos dang rgyan la sogs pa gzhan nyid do zhes zer ro //

original: gzhan dag na re kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag la dbang byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag la dbang byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is the power over affliction and purification.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams la pho'i dbang po med (rgya dpe gcig na bhe da rma bhe da: sems can gyi dbye ba 'phags pa'i dbye ba'o/) kyang sems can gyi khyad par 'grub pa'i phyir /

original: sems can gyi bye brag dang khyad par dag la dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi bye brag dang khyad par dag la dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: sems can gyi bye brag ni khyad par gyis byas pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: Thus means for the purpose of which.

original: de dag dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de dag dang mi ldan pa dang / de dag nyams pa'o //

original: mtshan gnyis pa ni gnyis ka nyams pa ste /

analyzed: gnas nyams pa dang bde ba chung ngu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyes par spyod pa rab dang de'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyes par spyod pa rab dang de'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ste /

analyzed: de ni sdom pa ma yin pa dang / mtshams med pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa rnams so //

analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di la kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du mjug par ma gyur na ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba khungs su smra'o //
translated: Ananda, if consciousness does not enter the mother‚Äôs womb,

analyzed: dbang gi ngo bo mthun par byed pa la dbang byed pa nyid kyis ni dbang gi lus dang ngag dag mthun par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the body and speech of one who has power are engaged in accordance with the mind, because of the power of the mind to make them act in accordance with itself.

analyzed: de nyid la khungs ni ji skad du zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te /
translated: The source for this is quoted:

analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid //
translated: ‚ÄúThis world is led by the mind,

analyzed: sems kyis yongs su drangs pa yin // sems kyi chos ni gcig pu yi //
translated: drawn by the mind.üîΩAll dharmas follow the one dharma

analyzed: dbang gi rjes su chos kun 'gro // zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: of the mind, which is powerful.‚Äù

analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la sems dbang byed par gsungs so //
translated: The meaning is that all the bases, i.e., the five appropriative aggregates, are governed by the mind, or that the body with its sense organs is governed by the mind.

analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis kun nas nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: The mind is afflicted by all the afflictions.

original: rnam par byang ba'i rgyus rnam par byang bar byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir kun nas @142a * //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rgyus rnam par byang bar byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir kun nas @142a * //
translated: because it is said that the cause of purification is that which purifies.

original: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag la dbang byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag la dbang byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus they are the controlling faculties with regard to defilement and purification.

original: lnga dang brgyad ni lnga dang brgyad po rnams te /
analyzed: lnga dang brgyad ni lnga dang brgyad po rnams te /
translated: The five and the eight are the five and the eight.

original: lnga ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / brgyad ni rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de /
analyzed: lnga ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / brgyad ni rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de /
translated: The five are the controlling faculties with regard to defilement and the eight are the controlling faculties with regard to purification,

original: grangs mi mnyam par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs mi mnyam par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are taught in an order that does not correspond to the number of controlling faculties.

original: de nyid kyi phyir go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: That is why he says: in that order.üîΩBecause attachment and so on increase in them,

original: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags la sogs brgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags la sogs brgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: means: because attachment and so on increase through the object-field and association.

original: ji skad du /üîΩtshor ba bde ba las ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du / tshor ba bde ba las ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: As it is said:üîΩAttachment increases from the sensation of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal las ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Aversion increases from the sensation of pain.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa las ni gti mug go //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa las ni gti mug go // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: From the neither pleasure nor pain feeling, delusion arises.

original: de lta mod kyi btang snyoms ni thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa de lta na yang 'dod chags kho na bde ba'o zhes nges par gzung bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi btang snyoms ni thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa de lta na yang 'dod chags kho na bde ba'o zhes nges par gzung bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Even though equanimity is concomitant with all of them, it should be understood that pleasure is definitely asserted to be only attachment,

original: gti mug kyang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar skyon med do //
analyzed: gti mug kyang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar skyon med do //
translated: and that delusion is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de zhes bya ba de nyid la rgyu smos pa ni /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de zhes bya ba de nyid la rgyu smos pa ni /
translated: Faith and so on are the controlling faculties of purification.üîΩThe reason for this is stated:

original: de dag gis rnam par byang bar byed do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag gis rnam par byang bar byed do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They purify.

original: gang gi phyir de dag gis rnam par byang bar byed pa de'i phyir de dag rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag par byed do zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gis rnam par byang bar byed pa de'i phyir de dag rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag par byed do zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Because they purify, they are the controlling faculties of purification.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: It is said:

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dad pa'i sgo gtan phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dad pa'i sgo gtan phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: The noble disciple who has the excellent door bolt of faith,

original: brtson 'grus kyi dpung phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dpung phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: the excellent army of effort,

original: dran pa'i sgo srung phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: dran pa'i sgo srung phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: the excellent doorkeeper of mindfulness,

original: sems mnyam par gzhag ba ni shes rab kyi mtshon gyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag ba ni shes rab kyi mtshon gyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and the well-equipoised mind is liberated by the weapon of wisdom.

original: gsum pa dag ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: gsum pa dag ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: The third is included in these three.

original: gzhan dag na re bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba la yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba la yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say: Pleasure and so on are also for purification.

original: yang gi sgra ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la yang ngo zhes bya bar rtogs te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la yang ngo zhes bya bar rtogs te /
translated: The term also indicates that they are also for affliction.

original: bde bar gyur ba'i sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: bde bar gyur ba'i sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: A mind that is happy is well equipoised.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: A well-equipoised mind fully knows reality as it is.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pas 'dod chags dang bral @142b bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pas 'dod chags dang bral @142b bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who fully knows reality as it is becomes free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and through freedom from passion, one becomes liberated.

original: de ltar na bde ba'i dbang po rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na bde ba'i dbang po rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed do //
translated: Thus, the faculty of pleasure also has a controlling power over purification.

original: dad pa gang la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can te rgyu can du yod pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: dad pa gang la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can te rgyu can du yod pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste /
translated: Faith that has suffering as its cause is the cause of suffering.

original: 'dis ni dad pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po yang rnam par byang ba la dbang byed par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dad pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po yang rnam par byang ba la dbang byed par ston to //
translated: This shows that the faculty of suffering also has a controlling power over purification, because faith has suffering as its cause.

original: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug ni nges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug ni nges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The six that are based on renunciation are focused on renunciation.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i lam ste /
translated: Renunciation is the path, both with and without impurity.

original: yid bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the faculty of mental pleasure, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes mental displeasure and equanimity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dbye bas ni rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dbye bas ni rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
translated: They are divided into six types by the division of their objects, such as form, etc.

original: mdo las ji skad du /üîΩmig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams brten nas yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du / mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams brten nas yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa /

original: nges par 'byung ba dang mthun pa nges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la brten nas yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang mthun pa nges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la brten nas yid bde ba nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang /
translated: it is compatible with renunciation and it focuses on renunciation.

original: de bzhin du yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyang bsdus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyang bsdus pa lta bu'o //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction and equanimity are also included in this way.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la so sor rtog pa la ni yongs su dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi yid bde ba dge ba 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la so sor rtog pa la ni yongs su dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi yid bde ba dge ba 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye la /
translated: Mental satisfaction that is virtuous and free from attachment arises in dependence on investigating forms and so on because it is compatible with renunciation and it is preceded by thorough analysis.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag gis bslus pa la ni tshul bzhin du yid mi bde ba 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba la brten pa'o //

translated: It is equanimity that is based on renunciation because it

original: pa mi srid pas slob dpon ma rangs par ston par byed do //
analyzed: pa mi srid pas slob dpon ma rangs par ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the Master Vasubandhu shows his displeasure with this interpretation.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni dpe ston pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni dpe ston pa rnams so //
translated: Others say: the teachers of the simile.

original: rnam par shes nas yang ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes nas yang ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having perceived, one abandons the weak.

original: de la gnod pa byung ba yongs su gcod pas rnam par shes pa yang ba spong gi mig dang rna ba dag gis ni lus su bsrung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gnod pa byung ba yongs su gcod pas rnam par shes pa yang ba spong gi mig dang rna ba dag gis ni lus su bsrung ba ma yin te /
translated: Having perceived, one abandons the weak, because one eliminates the occurrence of harm. The eye and ear do not protect the body,

original: 'di ltar ma byung ba ni mthong zhing thos kyang yongs su mi spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma byung ba ni mthong zhing thos kyang yongs su mi spong ngo //
translated: because although one sees and hears what has not occurred, one does not abandon it.

original: gal te lus yongs su bsrung ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te lus yongs su bsrung ba ma yin na /
translated: If the body is not protected,

original: de dag gang la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: de dag gang la dbang byed ce na /
translated: what do these two control?

original: de gnyis rnam par shes pa la ni dbang byed do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de gnyis rnam par shes pa la ni dbang byed do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said that these two control consciousness.

original: na'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa kho na la'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa kho na la'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to indicate that they control consciousness alone.

original: gal te mig gis mthong ngo rna bas thos so zhes bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig gis mthong ngo rna bas thos so zhes bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it said that the eye sees and the ear hears?

original: de'i phyir gzugs mthong ba dang sgra thos pa dag la yang thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu gnyis la dbang byed par shes pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs mthong ba dang sgra thos pa dag la yang thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu gnyis la dbang byed par shes pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even in seeing forms and hearing sounds, the eye and ear are not the dominant faculties with regard to the two uncommon causes.

original: de lta na lus yongs su bsrung ba la dbang byed pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta na lus yongs su bsrung ba la dbang byed pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in their being dominant faculties with regard to the protection of the body.

original: gang dag gi ltar na rnam par shes pa kho nas mthong ba dang thos pa de dag gi ltar na lus bsrung ba la mig dang rna ba dag dbang byed pa 'gal lo //
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na rnam par shes pa kho nas mthong ba dang thos pa de dag gi ltar na lus bsrung ba la mig dang rna ba dag dbang byed pa 'gal lo //
translated: But for those who maintain that seeing and hearing are done by consciousness alone, it would contradict the fact that the eye and ear are dominant faculties with regard to the protection of the body.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa gzugs mthong ba'am sgra thos pa med pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa gzugs mthong ba'am sgra thos pa med pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause there is no seeing of form or hearing of sound that is other than consciousness.‚Äù

original: gal te mig gis mthong ngo rna bas thos so zhes bya ba de yang rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pas mthong ba dang thos par bshad do //
analyzed: gal te mig gis mthong ngo rna bas thos so zhes bya ba de yang rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pas mthong ba dang thos par bshad do //
translated: If it is said that the eye sees and the ear hears, that is explained as seeing and hearing in the sense of being the basis of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir de la de nyid dbang byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la de nyid dbang byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is not that they themselves are dominant faculties with regard to that.

original: gang zhig mthong ba la sogs pa'i byed pa la yod pa bya ba'i dus su de mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang gzugs la sogs pa smos pa las gzhan ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa smos pa yang rnam par shes pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang zhig mthong ba la sogs pa'i byed pa la yod pa bya ba'i dus su de mi gnas pa'i phyir ro // gzugs mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang gzugs la sogs pa smos pa las gzhan ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa smos pa yang rnam par shes pa nyid kyis so //
translated: because it does not exist at the time of the action of seeing, etc.üîΩAnd the statement ‚Äúbecause of seeing visible form‚Äù is not different from the statement ‚Äúbecause of visible form,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pas gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pas gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of visible form,‚Äù etc. is also by consciousness itself; it is not by something other than consciousness that visible form, etc. is seen.

original: lus mdzes pa la rten kho na dbang byed kyi /
analyzed: lus mdzes pa la rten kho na dbang byed kyi /
translated: The body is the basis of beauty, and it is the basis that is the dominant condition.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir dbang po rnams ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir dbang po rnams ma yin te /
translated: It is not the faculties, because they are beyond the senses.

original: 'di yang mdzes par bya ba'i don dang tshig gi don du rten kho nas tshig gi zhes sngar bshad zin pas nye bar ma bkod do //
analyzed: 'di yang mdzes par bya ba'i don dang tshig gi don du rten kho nas tshig gi zhes sngar bshad zin pas nye bar ma bkod do //
translated: And this is not stated here, because it has already been explained above that the statement ‚Äúthe basis‚Äù is for the sake of the meaning of beauty and the meaning of the word.

original: sna la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang lus yongs su bsrung ba nyid ma yin @143b te ;
analyzed: sna la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang lus yongs su bsrung ba nyid ma yin @143b te ;
translated: The body is not protected by the nose, etc.

original: dbang po rnams kyis gnod par 'gyur ba'i kham gyi zas kyang yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyid kyi dbang po yang /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyis gnod par 'gyur ba'i kham gyi zas kyang yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro // yid kyi dbang po yang /
translated: and also because one experiences the material food that is harmful to the faculties.

original: yang srid nyid mtshams sbyor ba la dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang srid nyid mtshams sbyor ba la dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The mental faculty is not the dominant condition for the rebirth-linking consciousness,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis yang srid nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa rnams de'i dbang gis mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis yang srid nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa rnams de'i dbang gis mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because rebirth-linking is due to the power of karma and afflictions, and because the noble ones do not engage in rebirth-linking through the power of the mental faculty.

original: 'di la don rnams kyang dbang byed pa ma yin nam zhen zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la don rnams kyang dbang byed pa ma yin nam zhen zhes bya ba la /
translated: But don‚Äôt objects also act as dominant conditions?

original: ji ltar dbang po med par dmigs pa mi 'gyur ba de ltar don med par yang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po med par dmigs pa mi 'gyur ba de ltar don med par yang zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as objects are not observed without faculties, so too objects are not observed without faculties.

original: 'on kyang dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang po bzhin no //
translated: However, it is like the faculties.

original: de la dbang byed kyi don la dbang byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dbang byed kyi don la dbang byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is not the object that is the dominant condition.

original: lhag par gtso bor byed pa ni dbang byed pa ste dbang byed pa dang gtso bo nyid dag rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: lhag par gtso bor byed pa ni dbang byed pa ste dbang byed pa dang gtso bo nyid dag rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is that which acts as the principal cause. Dominant condition and principal cause are equivalents.

original: gtso bo nyid ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel par skye bas de'i phyir bdag po nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel par skye bas de'i phyir bdag po nyid kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmaster‚Äù is that it is the cause and result of that, and it is born in connection with that.

original: lhag par dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag par dbang byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a dominant master,

original: de la lhag par dbang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lhag par dbang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no dominant mastery over that.

original: yang lhag par dbang byed pa'i don gang yin pa med pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang lhag par dbang byed pa'i don gang yin pa med pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúdominant mastery‚Äù?

original: gzugs thams cad dmigs par bya ba la zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs thams cad dmigs par bya ba la zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúit is the object of all forms,‚Äù

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it conforms to the clear, unclear, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'khrugs pa dang ma 'khrugs pa dang rig pa dang mi rigs pa'i rjes su byed pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'khrugs pa dang ma 'khrugs pa dang rig pa dang mi rigs pa'i rjes su byed pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the conforming to the confused and unconfused, the proper and improper.

original: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not the case with form, because it is the opposite of that.

original: gzugs thams cad dmigs pa la mig bzhin du gzugs ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs thams cad dmigs pa la mig bzhin du gzugs ni ma yin te /
translated: Form is not like the eye, which is the object of all forms.

original: thun mong ba'i rgyur yid ches shing nges pa'i gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa de la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i byed pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: thun mong ba'i rgyur yid ches shing nges pa'i gzugs dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa de la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i byed pa mi 'jug go //
translated: The form that is the cause of the object of observation is the cause of the ascertainment and confidence in the common cause. Therefore, the function of clarity and non-clarity does not engage that object of observation.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la dbang byed kyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la dbang byed kyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the form that is the dominant condition of form and so on, but it is not form.

original: yid chos rnams la dbang byed pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid chos rnams la dbang byed pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same should be applied up to the mind being the dominant condition of phenomena.

original: rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid rnams sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams dmigs pa la lhag par dbang byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid rnams sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams dmigs pa la lhag par dbang byed pa yin te /
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are the dominant conditions of the observation of sound, smell, taste, tactility, and phenomena.

original: sgra la sogs pa thams cad dmigs pa'i thun mong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa thams cad dmigs pa'i thun mong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are the common cause of the observation of all sound and so on.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dmigs te /üîΩde @144a * //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dmigs te / de @144a * //
translated: They are observed because they are the cause of clarity and non-clarity and so on.

original: las bzlog pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa rnams la ma yin te /
analyzed: las bzlog pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa rnams la ma yin te /
translated: They are not sound and so on because they are the opposite of that.

original: de mtshungs rnams dbang po ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mtshungs rnams dbang po ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the other similar faculties would not be faculties.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says that this is illogical,

original: de mtshungs rnams kyis dbang byed pa med de /
analyzed: de mtshungs rnams kyis dbang byed pa med de /
translated: because the other similar faculties do not exercise controlling power,

original: de dag gis rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag gis rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because they do not generate consciousness.

original: 'o na rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask what is the reason that the other similar faculties do not exercise controlling power,

original: de la dbang po ma yin par thal ba med de /
analyzed: de la dbang po ma yin par thal ba med de /
translated: then the consequence that they are not faculties does not follow,

original: rten pa dang bcas pa'i rigs yin pa'i phyir de yang dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rten pa dang bcas pa'i rigs yin pa'i phyir de yang dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: because they are the same type as those that are supported by a faculty and they are also called faculties.

original: de ma yin na khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags bral ba'i yid /
analyzed: de ma yin na khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags bral ba'i yid /
translated: If they were not faculties, then the mind of one free from attachment to the three realms

original: yang srid mtshams sbyor ba la dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par 'jug pa mi ldan pa'i phyir dbang po ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: yang srid mtshams sbyor ba la dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par 'jug pa mi ldan pa'i phyir dbang po ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
translated: would not possess engagement that is compatible with the nature of the faculty that links to existence, and thus it would not be a faculty.

original: bye brag tu smra ba la ni de mtshungs dbang po ma yin par thal ba nyid do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba la ni de mtshungs dbang po ma yin par thal ba nyid do //
translated: For the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, the consequence is that the other similar faculties would not be faculties.

original: rten gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis dbang byed par yang brjod pa ni lhag ma gsum pa med na yang 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: rten gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis dbang byed par yang brjod pa ni lhag ma gsum pa med na yang 'di la skyon med do //
translated: Even though there is no third condition, there is no fault in this explanation.

original: gnas kho na rten du gzung ba nyid yin na yang dbang po ma yin par ma brten pa'i phyir dbang po ma yin par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: gnas kho na rten du gzung ba nyid yin na yang dbang po ma yin par ma brten pa'i phyir dbang po ma yin par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
translated: If the eye is the support of the object, it is difficult to avoid the consequence that the eye is not a sense faculty because it does not support the object.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: It is said:

original: mig thams cad gzugs thams cad dmigs par bya ba la thun mong gi rgyu ma yin te skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mig thams cad gzugs thams cad dmigs par bya ba la thun mong gi rgyu ma yin te skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The eye is not the common cause of all forms because it is momentary.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir thams cad nyid rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am rgyas pa las byung ba'i mig skad cig ma nyid la skad cig so sor gzugs thams cad dmigs pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ste /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te / gang gi phyir thams cad nyid rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am rgyas pa las byung ba'i mig skad cig ma nyid la skad cig so sor gzugs thams cad dmigs pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ste /
translated: That is not so.üîΩBecause all eyes that arise from karmic maturation or from enhancement are momentary, they are the cause of observing all forms in each moment.

original: gang yang dmigs pa'i yul bzung bas lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis de skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gang yang dmigs pa'i yul bzung bas lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis de skyed par byed de /
translated: Also, the object that is observed is the dominant condition because it generates the eye through the state of being a cooperative cause.

original: de yul gyi dngos por gzhan gyis ma yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩgzugs thams cad dmigs pa skyed par nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yul gyi dngos por gzhan gyis ma yin pa de'i phyir / gzugs thams cad dmigs pa skyed par nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not another thing that is the object,

original: skad cig so sor gzugs thams cad dmigs pa la thun mong gi rgyu nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: skad cig so sor gzugs thams cad dmigs pa la thun mong gi rgyu nyid ces bshad do //
translated: it is said that it is the common cause of all forms, because it is able to generate the observation of all forms.

original: gzugs ser po mig gis mthong ba yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe sngon po dmigs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ser po mig gis mthong ba yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe sngon po dmigs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the observation of a yellow form by the eye, which sometimes becomes the cause of the observation of blue.

original: mig dang gzugs mnyam pa nyid med do //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs mnyam pa nyid med do //
translated: There is no equality of the eye and form.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: It was explained thatüîΩwhen there is conformity, the cause is not generated, because it conforms to what is not generated.

original: rjes su byed pa la yang rgyu med par skye ba la rjes su byed pa'i phyir ma skyes pa skyes pa'i phyir mtshungs pa la dbang byed pas /
analyzed: rjes su byed pa la yang rgyu med par skye ba la rjes su byed pa'i phyir ma skyes pa skyes pa'i phyir mtshungs pa la dbang byed pas /
translated: It is not similar to what is generated, because it is generated.

original: gang yang rung @144b ba zhig ma tshang na mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rung @144b ba zhig ma tshang na mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to say that if any one of them is incomplete, it is not generated.

original: ma skyes pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs med pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po yang de'i rgyu nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs med pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po yang de'i rgyu nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no state that is not a consequence of the non-arisen, and therefore the eye faculty would also be its cause.

original: de'i phyir dbang po las byung ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na bsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po las byung ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na bsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the difference between the clear and unclear, etc., is due to the consciousness itself that arises from the faculty.

original: gang zhig dbang po ma yin pa'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba de ltar na dmigs pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa de mi snang ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dbang po ma yin pa'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba de ltar na dmigs pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa de mi snang ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no //
translated: That which is said to be a consequence of what is not a faculty is thus the consciousness that arises from the object, which has become the nature of non-appearance.

original: gang gis de yul rnam par shes par byed do zhes bya ba yang de'i rnam pa skye ba dang mi skye ba las gzhan rnam par shes pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de yul rnam par shes par byed do zhes bya ba yang de'i rnam pa skye ba dang mi skye ba las gzhan rnam par shes pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And that which is said to make that object known does not exist as the activity of consciousness apart from the arising and non-arising of its aspect.

original: de'i phyir rgyu kho na 'dir rjes su byed pa'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu kho na 'dir rjes su byed pa'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the cause alone is the consequence here.

original: gang bshad pa dmigs pa'i rten gyi rjes su byed pa nyid kyis mig gis lus yongs su bsrung ba gtso bor ma grub ste /
analyzed: gang bshad pa dmigs pa'i rten gyi rjes su byed pa nyid kyis mig gis lus yongs su bsrung ba gtso bor ma grub ste /
translated: The eye is not established as the primary protector of the body, because it is subordinate to the object.

original: gtso bo ma yin pa gtso bo'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pa gtso bo'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye is subordinate to the object, because it is subordinate to something else, which is not primary.

original: 'di yang shes par byed pa don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yang shes par byed pa don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is also understood because the object is not something else.

original: 'dir ni yul dang dbang po dag gtso bo ma yin pa gzhan gyi rjes su byed par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni yul dang dbang po dag gtso bo ma yin pa gzhan gyi rjes su byed par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the object and the sense faculty are understood to be subordinate to something else, which is not primary.

original: lus yongs su bsrung ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus yongs su bsrung ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is not primary, because it is subordinate to the mind.

original: gang yang dmigs pa'i rten yod kyang yang ba ma mthong bas prastha la ltung ba nam zhes bshad pa 'di ni mthong ba dang thos pa dag la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gang yang dmigs pa'i rten yod kyang yang ba ma mthong bas prastha la ltung ba nam zhes bshad pa 'di ni mthong ba dang thos pa dag la yang mtshungs so //
translated: Also, the statement that the eye is the primary protector of the body because it is the basis of perception is not seen in the case of lightness, since it is seen to fall to the ground. This is the same for seeing and hearing.

original: gang sngar bshad pa'i don bcu gcig kho na 'dir yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gang sngar bshad pa'i don bcu gcig kho na 'dir yang bshad pa ni /
translated: The eleven topics explained above are also explained here.

original: de'i don nges par gzung ba'i phyir slar yang brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don nges par gzung ba'i phyir slar yang brjod pa ste /
translated: They are stated again in order to ascertain their meaning.

original: lus yongs su bsrung ba la sogs pa la mig la sogs pa rnams dbang byed par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lus yongs su bsrung ba la sogs pa la mig la sogs pa rnams dbang byed par sbyar ro //
translated: The eyes, etc. are applied to the controlling faculty of the eye, etc. in the sense that they control the protection of the body, etc.

original: lus kyi dbang po kho na las zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po kho na las zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe body faculty is the collection of atoms that make up the body.‚Äù

original: reg bya'i yul can yin pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: reg bya'i yul can yin pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not different from the body faculty‚Äù means that it is not different from the body faculty because it is the sense faculty that experiences tactile objects.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du reg bya'i yul can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du reg bya'i yul can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were different, it would not be the sense faculty that experiences tactile objects, like the eye faculty, etc.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir yang lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir yang lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is not different from the body faculty because it is the basis of the body consciousness.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa ltar mi lus kyi rnam par rtog pa'i bar du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa ltar mi lus kyi rnam par rtog pa'i bar du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were different, it would not be the basis of the body consciousness, like the eye faculty, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Therefore, the body faculty is a part of the body that exists in the desire realm.

original: @145a * // 'dod chags dang lhan cig skyes pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can kho na'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: @145a * // 'dod chags dang lhan cig skyes pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can kho na'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the basis of the afflicted form of body consciousness that arises simultaneously with attachment.

original: mo nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / pho nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir na mo'i dbang po dang pho'i dbang po rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mo nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / pho nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir na mo'i dbang po dang pho'i dbang po rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The female organ is posited because of the dominance of femininity, and the male organ is posited because of the dominance of masculinity.

original: mo nyid ni mo'i ngo'i bo'o /
analyzed: mo nyid ni mo'i ngo'i bo'o /
translated: Femininity is the nature of a woman.

original: bsam pa la yang ngo bo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsam pa la yang ngo bo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Nature is also called essence.

original: de'i phyir bud med kyi cha byad dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bud med kyi cha byad dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúthe bodily form of a woman.‚Äù

original: kha cig cha byad kyang don gzhan yin par sems pa de'i phyir nga ro dang g-yo ba dang bsam pa dag ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: kha cig cha byad kyang don gzhan yin par sems pa de'i phyir nga ro dang g-yo ba dang bsam pa dag ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Some people think that bodily form is a separate entity. Therefore, the root text adds, ‚Äúvoice, behavior, and thoughts.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to analyze this very topic, the root text states,

original: de ni mo'i mo nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni mo'i mo nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the nature of femininity.‚Äù

original: ji ltar kha cig rtog par byed pa ltar bud med kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid don gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig rtog par byed pa ltar bud med kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid don gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of femininity is not a separate entity that has the characteristics of a woman, as some people imagine.

original: pho'i ngo bo ni pho'i cha byad dang zhes bya ba 'dir yang bshad zin pa'i rjes su 'brangs te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pho'i ngo bo ni pho'i cha byad dang zhes bya ba 'dir yang bshad zin pa'i rjes su 'brangs te brjod par bya'o //
translated: The nature of masculinity should be explained in the same way as femininity, following the same pattern as the explanation of femininity.

original: de la bud med kyi bsam pa ni skyes pa'i yul can te bud med ni skyes pa'i bsam pa can no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de la bud med kyi bsam pa ni skyes pa'i yul can te bud med ni skyes pa'i bsam pa can no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The thought of a woman is the object of a man, because it is said, ‚ÄúWomen have the thought of men.‚Äù

original: pho'i bsam pa ni bud med kyi yul can skyes pa dag ni bud med kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pho'i bsam pa ni bud med kyi yul can skyes pa dag ni bud med kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The thought of a man is the object of a woman, because it is said, ‚ÄúMen have the object of women.‚Äù

original: pho dang mo gnyis kyi nga ro yang tha dad de 'di ltar ma mthong bar pho'am mor skad kyis shes par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: pho dang mo gnyis kyi nga ro yang tha dad de 'di ltar ma mthong bar pho'am mor skad kyis shes par 'gyur ro /
translated: The voices of men and women are also different, because one can know whether it is a man or a woman by the sound of the voice without seeing the person.

original: g-yo ba dang 'phros la sogs pa yang pho dang mo rnams la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun par dmigs so //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang 'phros la sogs pa yang pho dang mo rnams la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun par dmigs so //
translated: The movements, gestures, and so on, of men and women are also observed to be different.

original: 'dir yang nga ro dang g-yo ba dang bsam pa rnams so //üîΩbud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po dbye ba tha dad pa la rgyud gzhan dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang nga ro dang g-yo ba dang bsam pa rnams so // bud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po dbye ba tha dad pa la rgyud gzhan dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, voice, movement, and thought are the three.

original: sems can gyi dbye ba las mo nyid dang pho nyid rgyu mtshan de nyid las mo dang pho'i ming 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can gyi dbye ba las mo nyid dang pho nyid rgyu mtshan de nyid las mo dang pho'i ming 'jug go //
translated: The distinction of the female and male faculties is not a different stream, because the female and male names are applied on the basis of that very reason, namely, the distinction of sentient beings as female and male.

original: nu ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni 'khrul ba'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: nu ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni 'khrul ba'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: The shape of the breasts, etc. is not the female organ, because it is deceptive.

original: sems can gyi khyad par ni mo dang pho'i dbang bos byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi khyad par ni mo dang pho'i dbang bos byas pa nyid do //

original: skye mched drug gi rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of life force maintains them because it prevents the severance of the continuum of the six bases.

original: tshor ba rnams kyis ni nye bar spyod par byed de 'jug pa'i rten la phan pa dang gnod pa byed par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyis ni nye bar spyod par byed de 'jug pa'i rten la phan pa dang gnod pa byed par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Feelings cause one to experience, because they engage in benefiting or harming the basis of engagement.

original: de ltar na bcu bzhi po 'di dag ni 'jug pa la gtso bor byed par zhugs pa'i phyir dbang po nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na bcu bzhi po 'di dag ni 'jug pa la gtso bor byed par zhugs pa'i phyir dbang po nyid do //
translated: Thus, these fourteen are faculties because they engage in being the predominant factors for engagement.

original: rnam pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rten la sogs pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rten la sogs pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In that same way means in the way of being a basis, etc.

original: gzhan dag ni ldog pa yin te zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la ldog pa ni mi 'jug pa ste de yang skye mched drug gtan 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ldog pa yin te zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la ldog pa ni mi 'jug pa ste de yang skye mched drug gtan 'gags pa'o //
translated: The others are the opposite of that, etc. The opposite of that is non-engagement, which is the complete cessation of the six sense spheres.

original: de thob pa'i rten ni dang po la sogs pa rnams yin te ;
analyzed: de thob pa'i rten ni dang po la sogs pa rnams yin te ;
translated: The basis for attaining that is the faculties of faith, etc.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye ba la de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye ba la de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are predominant in the generation of all roots of virtue.

original: skye ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin te /
translated: The faculty of producing complete knowledge is generation,

original: nangs kyi dang por yang dag par nges pa'i phung po la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nangs kyi dang por yang dag par nges pa'i phung po la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the first to be generated in the aggregate of correct resolve.

original: gnas pa'i kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te rgyun dang ldan par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te rgyun dang ldan par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of understanding is the faculty of abiding, because it is engaged in continuity.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos nye bar spyod par byed do //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos nye bar spyod par byed do //
translated: The faculty of one who has understood is the one that experiences.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is distinguished by abiding happily in this life.

original: yang na ldog pa rnam pa gnyis te nyon mongs pa ldog pa dang skye ba ldog pa ste /
analyzed: yang na ldog pa rnam pa gnyis te nyon mongs pa ldog pa dang skye ba ldog pa ste /
translated: Or else, there are two kinds of cessation: cessation of the defilements and cessation of birth.

original: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa ldog pa la dgongs te lhag ma snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa ldog pa la dgongs te lhag ma snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, cessation of the defilements is intended, and the rest is as before.

original: yang na 'dis 'khor ba ldog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dis 'khor ba ldog par byed pa ste /
translated: Or else, this causes the cessation of cyclic existence.

original: ldog pa'i rten zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rten zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The basis of cessation is the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: de'i phyir dang pa la sogs pa ni ldog pa'i rten no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang pa la sogs pa ni ldog pa'i rten no //
translated: Therefore, faith and so on are the basis of cessation.

original: lam gyi tshogs su gyur ba'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: lam gyi tshogs su gyur ba'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni skye ba ste /
translated: The faculty of understanding is birth, because it is the collection of the path.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi dang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi dang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the first of the uncontaminated paths.

original: de bzhin du kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po skyed pa gnas pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te rgyun dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po skyed pa gnas pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te rgyun dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the faculty of producing complete knowledge is the faculty of complete knowledge, because it is the continuity of the faculty of producing complete knowledge.

original: de ltar na kun shes pa'i dbang po ni ldog pa gnas par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na kun shes pa'i dbang po ni ldog pa gnas par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus the faculty of complete knowledge is the faculty that causes cessation.

original: nye bar spyod pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang pos byed de /üîΩrnam @149a * //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang pos byed de / rnam @149a * //
translated: The faculty of enjoyment is the faculty of complete knowledge,

original: par grol ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba yang dag par myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par grol ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba yang dag par myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it experiences the joy and pleasure of liberation.

original: sems rnam par ma grol ba la mya ngan las 'das pa med pa'i phyir kun shes ldan pa'i dbang po yang ldog par byed pa nyid la 'gal pa med do //
analyzed: sems rnam par ma grol ba la mya ngan las 'das pa med pa'i phyir kun shes ldan pa'i dbang po yang ldog par byed pa nyid la 'gal pa med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in saying that the faculty of possessing complete knowledge is the faculty that causes cessation, because there is no nirvana for one whose mind is not liberated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang po de snyed cig gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang po de snyed cig gsungs te /
translated: Therefore the BhagavƒÅn taught just that number of faculties,

original: de snyed cig kho nas brjod par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de snyed cig kho nas brjod par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because just that number is sufficient to complete the purpose that is intended.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa dbang po nyid du kha bskang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa dbang po nyid du kha bskang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore ignorance and so on are not added to the faculties.

original: mdo gnyis las bshad pa'i dbang po'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo gnyis las bshad pa'i dbang po'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the objects of the two sense faculties explained in the two s≈´tras are impossible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi go rims kyang de yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi go rims kyang de yin te /
translated: Therefore, their order is also that.

original: sems kyi rten yin pa'i phyir sngar mig la sogs pa rnams bshad do //
analyzed: sems kyi rten yin pa'i phyir sngar mig la sogs pa rnams bshad do //
translated: The eye, etc. are explained first because they are the supports of the mind.

original: de'i phyir bye brag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su pho dang mo'i dbang po'o zhes bya ba rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su pho dang mo'i dbang po'o zhes bya ba rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because they are the specific causes, the male and female faculties are explained immediately after that.

original: yang na ldog pa ni 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas skye mched drug 'jug pa'i rten nyid du sngar bshad de /
analyzed: yang na ldog pa ni 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas skye mched drug 'jug pa'i rten nyid du sngar bshad de /
translated: Or, because the engagement of the faculties is preceded by the engagement of the eye, etc., the six bases are explained first as the support of engagement.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be applied extensively to the others.

original: dag ni dbang po ma yin pa nyid de /üîΩtshig tu brjod pa'i yul la dbang byed pas dbang po nyid de /
analyzed: dag ni dbang po ma yin pa nyid de / tshig tu brjod pa'i yul la dbang byed pas dbang po nyid de /
translated: The two faculties of pain and mental dissatisfaction are not faculties because they are not dominant.üîΩThey are faculties because they dominate the expression of words.

original: de dang ldan pas dag la dbang po'i sgra 'jug pas so zhe na 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pas dag la dbang po'i sgra 'jug pas so zhe na 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: The term faculty is applied to them because they possess that.

original: dag ni brjod pa la dbang byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dag ni brjod pa la dbang byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The faculties do not exercise controlling power with regard to speech.

original: tshig tu smra ba la zhes sbyar te /üîΩde nyid slob pa'i rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tu smra ba la zhes sbyar te / de nyid slob pa'i rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith regard to speech‚Äù should be supplied.üîΩBecause the controlling power of these faculties depends on the specific causes of speech.

original: 'di ltar legs par sbyar ba dang tha mal ba'i yul gyi bye brag gis slob pa la bltos nas tshig tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar legs par sbyar ba dang tha mal ba'i yul gyi bye brag gis slob pa la bltos nas tshig tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the controlling power of these faculties is differentiated according to the specific objects of the learned and the unlearned.

original: gang zhig gang la dbang byed pa de dang de ni logs su slob pa la bltos pa ma yin te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la dbang byed pa de dang de ni logs su slob pa la bltos pa ma yin te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: That which exercises controlling power with regard to something is not differentiated according to the specific causes of that object, as is the case with visual consciousness, etc.

original: re zhig de dag dbang po nyid ci zhig yin gal te gang las tshig 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: re zhig de dag dbang po nyid ci zhig yin gal te gang las tshig 'byung ba yin na /
translated: What is the nature of these faculties? If they are the source of speech,

original: de lta na ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa dag dang / de dag kun nas slong ba'i rlung rnams kyang de'i dbang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa dag dang / de dag kun nas slong ba'i rlung rnams kyang de'i dbang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then conceptualization, discernment, etc., and the winds that motivate them would also be faculties.

original: gal te yang mgrin pa dang dkan dang mchu la sogs pa rnams la brten nas 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang mgrin pa dang dkan dang mchu la sogs pa rnams la brten nas 'byung mod kyi /
translated: Even though speech arises in dependence on the throat, palate, lips, etc.,

original: de lta na yang rtog pa la sogs pa dag de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rtog pa la sogs pa dag de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, they are primary because they motivate conceptualization, etc.

original: lag pa dang rkang pa yang @149b len pa dang 'gro ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa yang @149b len pa dang 'gro ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The hand and foot are not different from grasping and stepping,

original: lag pa de nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba la len pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lag pa de nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba la len pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: because the hand itself, arising in another place, is called grasping;

original: rkang pa de nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rkang pa de nyid gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba la 'gro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: and the foot itself, arising in another place, is called stepping.

original: de la ni skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyir yul gzhan du phyin pa med cing bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa yang med do //
analyzed: de la ni skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyir yul gzhan du phyin pa med cing bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa yang med do //
translated: But since they are not momentary, they do not go to another place, nor do they become something else.

original: de'i phyir len pa dang 'gro ba lag pa dang rkang pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir len pa dang 'gro ba lag pa dang rkang pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, grasping and stepping are not different from the hand and foot.

original: de'i phyir da la dbang byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir da la dbang byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not the dominant organs,

original: rang nyid la dbang byed par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rang nyid la dbang byed par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: because it is not possible for them to dominate themselves.

original: sbrul la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the snake, etc.,

original: sbrul la sogs pa rnams la lag pa dang rkang pa'i dbang po yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa rnams la lag pa dang rkang pa'i dbang po yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although snakes and so on do not have hands and feet,

original: de lta na yang khas len pa dang brang gis 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang khas len pa dang brang gis 'gro ba yin te /
translated: they move about by the power of their belly.

original: de bzhin du nya la sogs pa rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nya la sogs pa rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of fish and so on.

original: rkub kyang rtug par bya ba la dbang po nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /üîΩmi gtsang ba 'dor ba la'o //
analyzed: rkub kyang rtug par bya ba la dbang po nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni / mi gtsang ba 'dor ba la'o //
translated: The anus is not a controlling faculty with regard to defecation,

original: de ni rlung gis kyang bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rlung gis kyang bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the wind that expels the feces.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba bro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it expels the feces.

original: kha cig kha nas kyang bshang pa 'dor ba mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig kha nas kyang bshang pa 'dor ba mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Some see that feces is expelled through the mouth.

original: de lta na dbang po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'tshol bar 'gyur to //
analyzed: de lta na dbang po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'tshol bar 'gyur to //
translated: Thus, the establishment of the controlling faculties is sought.

original: khas len pa dang bshad pa 'dor ba'i phyir dang / lag pa gnyis kyis len pa dang 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len pa dang bshad pa 'dor ba'i phyir dang / lag pa gnyis kyis len pa dang 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the acceptance and the expulsion of the food, and because of the grasping and the movement by the two hands.

original: de bzhin du rkang pa gnyis kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa gnyis kyis kyang ngo //
translated: The same should be said of the two feet.

original: kun tu dga' ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu dga' ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba'o //
translated: Universal satisfaction is the satisfaction of the afflicted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba de ni pho dang mo'i dbang pos byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba de ni pho dang mo'i dbang pos byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause that pleasure is produced by the male and female faculties.‚Äù

original: gal te de nyid 'doms yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid 'doms yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that that itself is the sexual faculty,

original: de lta na 'on ni 'doms kyi dbang po lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'on ni 'doms kyi dbang po lus kyi dbang po las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: then the sexual faculty is not different from the body faculty,

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the male and female faculties are a part of the body faculty.

original: bya ba don gzhan gnyis med pa'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa bzhin du dag la sogs pa dbang po ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba don gzhan gnyis med pa'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa bzhin du dag la sogs pa dbang po ma yin no //
translated: The sexual faculties are not faculties like the eye faculty, etc., because they do not exercise dominance over their own objects.

original: de'i phyir kha bskang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha bskang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should not be added to the list of faculties.

original: de lta ma yin na lkog ma la sogs pa rnams kyang grangs bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang por thal bar gyur te nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na lkog ma la sogs pa rnams kyang grangs bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang por thal bar gyur te nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the throat, etc., would also be faculties, because they exercise dominance over their own objects, such as swallowing, etc., and there is no reason to specify the number of faculties.

original: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa thams cad kyang rang gi bya ba myu gu dang 'dab ma dang sbal mig 'chos pa'i @150a * //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa thams cad kyang rang gi bya ba myu gu dang 'dab ma dang sbal mig 'chos pa'i @150a * //
translated: All causes such as seeds and sprouts perform their function of producing sprouts, leaves, and so on.üîΩ

original: mtshan nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All causes such as the seed and sprout, etc., would be faculties because they exercise controlling power over their own activity, such as the sprout, leaf, and so on.

original: yang ci dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag rjes su'am 'on te btags bar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag rjes su'am 'on te btags bar 'dod ce na /
translated: Or else, do you assert that the twenty-two faculties are substantial or nominal?

original: dbang byed par bshad pas rdzas su nges so //
analyzed: dbang byed par bshad pas rdzas su nges so //
translated: They are definitely substantial because they are explained as controlling power.

original: gzhan dag na re rdzas su bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rdzas su bcu gcig ste /
translated: Others say: They are eleven substantial entities.

original: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag lus kyi dbang po'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir dang / dad pa la sogs pa rnams dang yid dang bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms rnams kun shes pa'i dbang po gsum du 'dus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag lus kyi dbang po'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir dang / dad pa la sogs pa rnams dang yid dang bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms rnams kun shes pa'i dbang po gsum du 'dus pa'i phyir te /
translated: The male and female faculties are included in the body faculty, and faith, the five such as pleasure, and the three such as the mental faculty are included in the three faculties such as the faculty of understanding.

original: de ldog pa rnams dad pa la sogs pa rnams dang yid la sogs pa rnams su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ldog pa rnams dad pa la sogs pa rnams dang yid la sogs pa rnams su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because those who lack these faculties possess faith, etc., and the mental faculty, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re nyi shu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nyi shu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that there are twenty.

original: dbang po'i don dang de rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbang po'i don dang de rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
translated: The objects of the faculties and the reasons for their classification have been explained.

original: de dag gis rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gis rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now their individual natures should be explained.

original: de la mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po la thug pa rnams ni bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /üîΩde dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po la thug pa rnams ni bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni / de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
translated: The eye and so on up to the male faculty have already been explained.üîΩThe faculties of eye and so on are the basis of the consciousnesses that perceive visible form and so on.

original: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba dang / lus las pho dang mo dbang dag //
analyzed: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams // zhes bya ba dang / lus las pho dang mo dbang dag //
translated: The eye and so on are the basis of the consciousnesses that perceive visible form and so on.

original: ces bya ba las so //
analyzed: ces bya ba las so //
translated: The male and female faculties are the characteristics of the primary elements that generate the male and female bodies.

original: bde ba la sogs pa dang / kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa ni bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dang / kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa ni bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The faculties of pleasure and so on and the faculty of producing complete knowledge and so on will now be explained.üîΩIf pleasure and so on are mental factors, like faith and so on, shouldn't they be explained among the mental factors?

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyang sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas bshad par bya ba ma yin nam zhen ma yin te /üîΩsems las byung ba dag tu ni //
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyang sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas bshad par bya ba ma yin nam zhen ma yin te /üîΩsems las byung ba dag tu ni //
translated: They are not explained there because they are not universal mental states.

original: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // zhes spyi'i dbang du byas kyi /
analyzed: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // zhes spyi'i dbang du byas kyi /
translated: are taught in general, but not in terms of their specific characteristics.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyid du de dag gi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su bab pas dbang po'i skabs 'di nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyid du de dag gi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs su bab pas dbang po'i skabs 'di nyid du ston par byed do //

analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms rnams 'di nyid nas 'chad na /

original: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: 'di dag gnas skabs gang zhig gi khyad par du 'phags pa na /

analyzed: kun shes par @150b byed pa zhes bya ba'i dbang po la sogs pa'i ming 'thob pa'i gnas skabs de bstan par bya dgos pas na /

analyzed: kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa'i dbang po bshad par bya ste de brjod par bya'o zhes de skad du bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: sems kyi sim pa ma yin pa yang yod pas lus kyi zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: de ni lus kyi yin par 'dod pa yang ma yin no zhe na de'i phyir /

analyzed: sems kyi de ni bde dbang po //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: sems kyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus kyi rnam par gcod par byed do //

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /

original: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: sems kyi tshor ba sim pa ni bde ba'i dbang po yin no //

analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por lus kyi sim pa bde ba'i dbang por rnam par bzhag la /

original: bsam gtan gsum par ni sems kyi yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum par ni sems kyi yin zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir lus tshor ba ni med do zhes bya ba smos so //

original: ci'i phyir med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med ce na /

analyzed: gzhan na de ni yid bde yin // zhes bya ba @151a * //

analyzed: la ; yid kyis sim par myang ba 'jug pa'i dbye ba'i rnam pas 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi tshor ba sim pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa las gzhan na yid bde ba'i dbang po yin no //

analyzed: gzhan na zhes smos pas bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong du yang der thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa na ni zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: de ni de dag kho nar srid pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa na ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //

analyzed: yid bde ba ni dga' ba ste sems las byung ba sim pa tsam mo //

analyzed: yid bde'i dbang po ni mi bstan par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: but the faculty of mental satisfaction is unstable,

original: sems pa yang yod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa yang yod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it also generates thought.üîΩThe faculty of pleasure is not like that,

analyzed: a'a nu gra ho pi r'urba sya n'a ti pa la b'anya thatta ra sy'a ta a'a p'a y'apta d'a gi sth'a na mi tye tsaksha te /

translated: If it is said that the faculty of pleasure is not possessed in the third absorption because it is not the faculty of mental pleasure that is the basis of investigation, then how could the faculty of pleasure be possessed in the first two absorptions?

analyzed: yid bde ni 'jug pa mi brtan pa yin la sems kyi bde ba'i dbang po ni 'jug pa brtan pa nyid do //

analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan la ming gzhan mthong ste mar sar dang mar bzhin no // lus kyis sim pa ma yin par @151b myong ba ni sdug bsngal yin la /

analyzed: de'i phyir btang snyoms ni bar ma'o zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs te /

analyzed: sim pa ni bde ba'i sim pa ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa yin la /

analyzed: 'dir ni bar ma'o zhes bshad pa de'i phyir sim pa yang ma yin pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa gnyi ga'i yin no zhes bya ste lus dang sems kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtog phyir zhes bya ba smos so //

translated: The word ‚Äúmostly‚Äù is used because the pleasure of joy is born from concentration, and is not born from conceptualization. The pleasure born from karmic maturation is born from the power of the object, and mental pleasure born from karmic maturation is not pain in equipoise.

analyzed: @152a * // 'di dag spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ston te /

analyzed: lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam par rtog pa las mi skye ba de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
