analyzed: yul 'dus pa la rnam par rtog pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The power of conceptualization does not exist in the union of the object.

original: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams la yang yul yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i dbang gis nges par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams la yang yul yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i dbang gis nges par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even for arhats who have abandoned the conceptualization of friends and enemies, it definitely arises due to the power of pleasant and unpleasant objects.

original: de'i phyir de dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ces bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthose‚Äù refers toüîΩbodily and mental pleasure and pain.

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag bde ba'i dbang po //
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag bde ba'i dbang po //
translated: The faculty of pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po //
translated: the faculty of pain,

original: yid bde'i dbang po //
analyzed: yid bde'i dbang po //
translated: the faculty of mental pleasure,

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes dbang po nyid kyis tha dad do //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes dbang po nyid kyis tha dad do //
translated: and the faculty of mental displeasure are differentiated by their nature as faculties.

original: btang snyoms ni lus kyi'am sems kyi'am rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni lus kyi'am sems kyi'am rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am /
translated: Equanimity is physical or mental, arisen from karmic maturation,

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yin yang rung ste ;
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yin yang rung ste ;
translated: or arisen from natural outflow.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar rang gi ngang gis mngon par 'du bya ba med par skye ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar rang gi ngang gis mngon par 'du bya ba med par skye ste /
translated: It is nonconceptual, arises by its own power, and arises without manifest activity.

original: de'i phyir dbang po gcig tu byas so //üîΩlus kyi bde ba yang gzhan du phan 'dogs pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po gcig tu byas so // lus kyi bde ba yang gzhan du phan 'dogs pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is considered a single faculty.üîΩPhysical pleasure and pain are limited to benefiting or harming the body,

original: lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni nyi tshe ba bzhugs pas lus dang / sems dag la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa yin la lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni drag pa dang mgyogs par byed pa dang rgyun chags pa yang yin gyi sems kyi ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni nyi tshe ba bzhugs pas lus dang / sems dag la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa yin la lus kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni drag pa dang mgyogs par byed pa dang rgyun chags pa yang yin gyi sems kyi ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: but physical pleasure and pain also benefit or harm the mind, they are intense and swift and they are continuous, but mental pleasure and pain are not like that.

original: yid la smon pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang sdug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu can gyis dus cung zad phan 'dogs pa'am gnod pa byed pa yod do //üîΩbtang snyoms pa ni lus kyi btang snyoms ni gzhan du phan 'dogs la /
analyzed: yid la smon pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang sdug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu can gyis dus cung zad phan 'dogs pa'am gnod pa byed pa yod do // btang snyoms pa ni lus kyi btang snyoms ni gzhan du phan 'dogs la /
translated: The faculty of equanimity is a slight benefit or harm that is the cause of a pleasant conception that fulfills a wish.

original: sems kyi yang gzhan du phan 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di med de /
analyzed: sems kyi yang gzhan du phan 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di med de /
translated: The faculty of equanimity is not distinguished as benefiting the body in one way and benefiting the mind in another.

original: de bas na btang snyoms la bye brag med pas lus kyi dang sems kyi dbang po tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na btang snyoms la bye brag med pas lus kyi dang sems kyi dbang po tha dad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since there is no distinction in equanimity, there is no separate faculty of equanimity.

original: gzhan dag na re gang du rnam par shes pa dang / lus tha dad pa der yid kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni brtan pa dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang du rnam par shes pa dang / lus tha dad pa der yid kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni brtan pa dang bral ba yin la /
translated: Others say: Where there is a difference in consciousness and body, mental pleasure and pain are unstable and changeable.

original: lus nyid kyi bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dang khyad par med pas de ni brtan pa kho na yin pas @152b dbang po gcig go zhes so //
analyzed: lus nyid kyi bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dang khyad par med pas de ni brtan pa kho na yin pas @152b dbang po gcig go zhes so //
translated: But bodily pleasure and pain are not unstable, since they are not distinguished as being either stable or unstable. Therefore there is no separate faculty of equanimity.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du lus kyi bde pa mdza' bshes rnams la 'jug la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du lus kyi bde pa mdza' bshes rnams la 'jug la /
translated: Others think that the faculty of pleasure is engaged in friends, physical pleasure,

original: gzhan du sems kyi sdug bsngal yang dgra bo rnams la ste /
analyzed: gzhan du sems kyi sdug bsngal yang dgra bo rnams la ste /
translated: the faculty of pain is engaged in enemies, mental suffering,

original: de bzhin du bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni bar ma rnams la'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni bar ma rnams la'o /
translated: and the faculty of mental neither pleasure nor pain is engaged in those who are neither.

original: de'i phyir bar ma'i phyogs la btang snyoms ni khyad par med pa'i phyir dbang po tha dad par ma bstan to zhes sems so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bar ma'i phyogs la btang snyoms ni khyad par med pa'i phyir dbang po tha dad par ma bstan to zhes sems so //
translated: Thus equanimity is not taught as a separate faculty, because it is not distinct in the neutral category.

original: zag pa med pa rnams kyi skabs su bab la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams kyi skabs su bab la /
translated: Now, the uncontaminated faculties are being discussed.

original: de dag la ni logs su bstan par bya ba cung zad kyang med mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang mthong sgom mi slob lam la dgu //
analyzed: de dag la ni logs su bstan par bya ba cung zad kyang med mod kyi / 'on kyang mthong sgom mi slob lam la dgu //
translated: There is nothing to be taught separately about them.üîΩHowever, they are the nine faculties of seeing, meditation, and no more learning.

original: gsum yin zhes lam gsum du dbang po dgu la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs par brjod do //
analyzed: gsum yin zhes lam gsum du dbang po dgu la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs par brjod do //
translated: The nine faculties are called the faculty of coming to know the unknown, etc., on the three paths of seeing, meditation, and no more learning.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams bum pa bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams bum pa bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na mi 'gyur te /
translated: Don‚Äôt the faculties of understanding all, etc., become the reality of designation, like a pot?

original: dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don yin la /
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don yin la /
translated: No, they do not, because the meaning of faculty is the meaning of controlling faculty.

original: tshogs pa dag kyang re re zhing dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa dag kyang re re zhing dbang byed pa'o //
translated: And each of the collections controls.

original: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dang po na yod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dang po na yod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The consciousness that exists on the first path of seeing, etc., is the mental faculty.

original: bde ba la sogs pa tshor ba'i dbang po gsum ni ci rigs par te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa tshor ba'i dbang po gsum ni ci rigs par te /
translated: The three faculties of feeling, pleasure, etc., exist in the appropriate way.

original: mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam dag nas drug pa dangs dgu pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam dag nas drug pa dangs dgu pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sixth and ninth are on the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: dge la thams cad dag tu lnga //
analyzed: dge la thams cad dag tu lnga //
translated: Five exist in all virtuous states.

original: zhes bya ba dang po la sogs pa dag ni thams cad na yod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang po la sogs pa dag ni thams cad na yod kyi /
translated: The first, etc., exist in all virtuous states.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams ni de ltar cig car srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams ni de ltar cig car srid pa ma yin no //
translated: But pleasure, mental pleasure, and equanimity do not exist simultaneously.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag la gnas skabs gsum du kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa nyid ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag la gnas skabs gsum du kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa nyid ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are these faculties called the faculty of producing complete knowledge, etc., in three stages?

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni bden pa bzhi mi shes pa kun shes so snyam du zhugs pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni bden pa bzhi mi shes pa kun shes so snyam du zhugs pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no //
translated: On the path of seeing, the faculty of producing complete knowledge is the entry to the thought ‚ÄúI will completely know the four truths that were not previously known.‚ÄùüîΩOn the path of meditation, there is no production of complete knowledge of what was not previously seen,

original: sgom pa'i lam la ni sngon ma mthong ba kun shes par byed pa ni med kyi zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa'i dbang po nyid kyis shes pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam la ni sngon ma mthong ba kun shes par byed pa ni med kyi zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa'i dbang po nyid kyis shes pa'i bden pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: because the four truths that are objects of knowledge of the faculty of complete knowledge have already been seen.

original: de'i phyir sgom pa'i lam la sngon med pa kun shes par bya ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgom pa'i lam la sngon med pa kun shes par bya ba med de /
translated: Therefore, on the path of meditation, there is no production of complete knowledge of what was not previously seen.

original: de'i phyir bden pa bzhi'i bden pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid dbang po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa bzhi'i bden pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid dbang po'o //
translated: Therefore, the faculty is that very complete knowledge of the four truths that were previously realized.

original: de nyid kun shes par byed pa'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩsgom pa'i lam ni mthong @153a * //
analyzed: de nyid kun shes par byed pa'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste / sgom pa'i lam ni mthong @153a * //
translated: That very complete knowledge is the faculty of complete knowledge.

original: ba'i lam gyis mngon par rtogs zin pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i lam gyis mngon par rtogs zin pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of meditation is the object of the four truths that were previously realized by the path of seeing.

original: gal te mthong ba'i lam nyid kyis bden pa bzhi kun shes par byas na yang ci'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyis rtogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i lam nyid kyis bden pa bzhi kun shes par byas na yang ci'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyis rtogs par byed ce na /
translated: If one fully knows the four truths by the path of seeing alone, why does one realize them by the path of cultivation?

original: phra rgyas lhag ma spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas lhag ma spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one abandons the remaining negative tendencies.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun shes par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun shes par byed pa yin la /
translated: Thus one fully knows the four truths by the path of seeing in order to abandon the negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: sgom pa'i lam gyis ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun shes pa yin no //
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam gyis ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun shes pa yin no //
translated: One fully knows the four truths by the path of cultivation in order to abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: kun shes so snyam pa dang ldan par rtogs pa ni kun shes ldan pa ste /
analyzed: kun shes so snyam pa dang ldan par rtogs pa ni kun shes ldan pa ste /
translated: One who possesses the thought ‚ÄúI fully know‚Äù is one who possesses full knowing.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i skad cig go //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i skad cig go //
translated: It is the moment of the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: de 'di la yod pas zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: One who possesses that is one who possesses full knowing.

original: de ltar gyur pa ni kun shes ldan pa'am kun shes bsrung ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ni kun shes ldan pa'am kun shes bsrung ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: One who possesses full knowing is one who guards full knowing.

original: kun shes bsrung ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na ldan pa ste /
analyzed: kun shes bsrung ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na ldan pa ste /
translated: Since this state possesses the nature of guarding complete knowledge, it is called possessing complete knowledge.

original: rtogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of realization.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po dang 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po dang 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the difference between the faculty of complete knowledge and this?

original: des kyang kun shes pa nyid yin no zhe na de'i phyir zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des kyang kun shes pa nyid yin no zhe na de'i phyir zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: If you say that it is complete knowledge itself, then it is said that it is due to obtaining the transcendent wisdom that is the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: de lta bu'i dbang po ni zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa rtogs pa dang bsrung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dbang po ni zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa rtogs pa dang bsrung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term such a faculty refers to the nature of realizing complete knowledge and guarding it.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re de ltar dbang po rnams ming gi sgo nas nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang rdzas su ni bcu bdun du 'gyur te /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re de ltar dbang po rnams ming gi sgo nas nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang rdzas su ni bcu bdun du 'gyur te /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says: In this way, the faculties are twenty two in name but seventeen in substance.

original: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa med pa rnams kyang dgu po rnams las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa med pa rnams kyang dgu po rnams las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the male and female faculties are one part of the body faculty, and because those not possessing the uncontaminated faculties are not other than those possessing nine faculties.

original: mthong bsgom mi slob lam la dgu //
analyzed: mthong bsgom mi slob lam la dgu //
translated: Nine faculties are on the paths of seeing, meditation, and no-more-learning.

original: gsum yin zhes pa yang srid pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ste rnam pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum yin zhes pa yang srid pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ste rnam pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: The statement that three are possible is from the perspective of existence, not from the perspective of aspect.

original: rnam pa las ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin gsum gong nas gong du mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas /
analyzed: rnam pa las ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin gsum gong nas gong du mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas /
translated: From the perspective of aspect, three faculties of the nature of wisdom obtain nirvana higher and higher.

original: dbang byed pas 'di dag aa sa ma dh'a n'a da pra barya tvatstsh'a dgongs pa can zhes pa'i tshig gis 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang byed pas 'di dag aa sa ma dh'a n'a da pra barya tvatstsh'a dgongs pa can zhes pa'i tshig gis 'phangs pa'o //
translated: Since they control that, they are called the three faculties of definite entry, because they are mentioned by the word adhipati.

original: shes rab kyi ldog pa las 'di dag dbang po bcu dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ldog pa las 'di dag dbang po bcu dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: From the perspective of the reversal of wisdom, these become nineteen faculties.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar lus kyi dbang po kho na'i dang ba'i khyad par la dbang byed pa'i dbye ba las mo dang pho'i dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar lus kyi dbang po kho na'i dang ba'i khyad par la dbang byed pa'i dbye ba las mo dang pho'i dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, just as the faculty of touch is called the male faculty and the female faculty due to the classification of the specific clarity of the faculty of touch,

original: (mnyam dang 'khyog pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang/) @153b de bzhin du dbang po dgu po rnams gnas skabs gsum nyid du 'gyur ba las shes rab kyi 'jug pa gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: (mnyam dang 'khyog pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang/) @153b de bzhin du dbang po dgu po rnams gnas skabs gsum nyid du 'gyur ba las shes rab kyi 'jug pa gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: so too, the nine faculties should be called the three engagements of wisdom due to the classification of three states.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa bzhin snga ma snga ma la rag las bas phyi ma phyi ma thob pas na phyi ma phyi ma mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la dbang byed pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa bzhin snga ma snga ma la rag las bas phyi ma phyi ma thob pas na phyi ma phyi ma mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la dbang byed pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin no //
translated: They are the nature of the faculties that obtain nirvana because they obtain the latter nirvana in dependence on the former, just as the absorptions and formless states are obtained in dependence on the former.

original: gang du ji ltar spros pa de ltar srid pa ma yin pas de spros pa ma yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang du ji ltar spros pa de ltar srid pa ma yin pas de spros pa ma yin zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is impossible to proliferate it in any way, it is called nonproliferation.

original: 'di dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de ltar srid pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di spros pa ma yin pa dang dgongs pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de ltar srid pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di spros pa ma yin pa dang dgongs pa can ma yin no //
translated: Since they do not exist in the way they are posited, they are not fabrications and are not interpretable in meaning.

original: sarb'a b'a chos rnam par gzhag pa dgongs pa can du 'gyur ro ;üîΩ/ gang 'dir rang gi ngo bo ston pa'i dbang du byas nas lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang /
analyzed: sarb'a b'a chos rnam par gzhag pa dgongs pa can du 'gyur ro ; / gang 'dir rang gi ngo bo ston pa'i dbang du byas nas lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang /
translated: All the phenomena posited in the Abhidharma would be interpretable in meaning.üîΩHere, in terms of teaching their intrinsic nature, the unpleasant bodily sensation is called the faculty of pain.

original: sdug bsngal dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag gi rang gi ngo bo bstan cing 'chad par 'gyur ba'i srog gi dbang po la sogs pa rnams rang gi ngo bo bstan zin par byas te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag gi rang gi ngo bo bstan cing 'chad par 'gyur ba'i srog gi dbang po la sogs pa rnams rang gi ngo bo bstan zin par byas te /
translated: The intrinsic nature of those is taught and the intrinsic nature of the life faculty and so on, which will be explained, is already taught.

original: rang gi ngo bo bstan nas zhes bya ba 'di mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bstan nas zhes bya ba 'di mngon par brjod do //
translated: Having taught their intrinsic nature, this is stated.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The specific types should be stated, such as contaminated and uncontaminated and so on.

original: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos bstan pa gang yin pa 'di yang chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos bstan pa gang yin pa 'di yang chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This treatise on Abhidharma is also for the purpose of discerning the Dharma, because it is the Dharma that is discerned in this treatise.

original: gsum ni dri ma med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum ni dri ma med ces bya ba la /
translated: The three are stainless.

original: gsum ni dri ma med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gsum ni dri ma med pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The three are stainless alone.

original: dgu rnam gnyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa'i lam gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir 'di dag zag pa dang bcas pa ni med do //üîΩgzugs can srog dang sdug bsngal dag //
analyzed: dgu rnam gnyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa'i lam gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir 'di dag zag pa dang bcas pa ni med do // gzugs can srog dang sdug bsngal dag //
translated: This is a restrictive rule, because it is said that the nine are of two kinds, and because they are included in the three uncontaminated paths.

original: zag dang bcas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: zag dang bcas pa kho na'o //
translated: The form aggregate, life faculty, and the nine types of sensation are only contaminated.

original: zhes nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: zhes nges par gzung ste /

original: btsun pa go cha mtha' yas na re /
analyzed: btsun pa go cha mtha' yas na re /

analyzed: tshe'i rnam par smin pa'i las ni mthong ba'i @157b chos la myong bar 'gyur bar yang mi rigs te /

analyzed: las 'bras bu nye ba 'bras bu ring ba ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de nyid kyi skye ba gsum pa ma yin na las de nyid mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur bar yang 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: de nyid skyes nas dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur bar 'gyur na /

translated: Because it is the homogeneous collection of former moments that is engaged and because the homogeneous collection of former moments does not appropriate, therefore the previously explained error does not arise.üîΩüîΩThe Sautrantikas say:üîΩThe homogeneous collection of former moments is engaged and the homogeneous collection of former moments does not appropriate.üîΩ

analyzed: 'di'i rgyud la gang cung zad rnam par smin pa de ni yid mi bde ba'i sems pa ma yin no zhes te /
translated: Whatever karmic maturation there is in the mindstream of that person is not the mental state of dissatisfaction.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mngon par 'dod pa ji lta ba las so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mngon par 'dod pa ji lta ba las so //
translated: It is like the desire realm for those who are free from attachment.

original: rgyud la rnam par smin par byed pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyud la rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes nye bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud la rnam par smin par byed pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyud la rnam par smin pa ma yin no zhes nye bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: and it is not in the mindstream of one who is free from attachment, since it is not matured in the mindstream.

original: de la brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa rnams ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /üîΩmig la sogs pa po'i dbang po'i mthar thug pa rnams ni brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa rnams ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la / mig la sogs pa po'i dbang po'i mthar thug pa rnams ni brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, those possessing the eighth, the faculty of life force, etc.üîΩThe faculties of eye, etc., up to the last of the faculties are called the eighth, the faculty of life force.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The faculties of eye, etc., are the eighth, the faculty of life force.

original: bde 'gro ni lha dang mi'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro ni lha dang mi'o //
translated: Happy rebirth is as a god or human.

original: ngan 'gro ni ngan song gsum mo //
analyzed: ngan 'gro ni ngan song gsum mo //
translated: Bad rebirth is the three lower rebirths.

original: yid kyi dbang po'i ni gnyis kar zhes bya ba la /üîΩgnyis ka zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po'i ni gnyis kar zhes bya ba la / gnyis ka zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu'o //
translated: The mental faculty is in both.üîΩBoth means happy rebirth and bad rebirth.

original: gnyis ka'i zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
translated: Both means virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: gang gi tshe yid kyi dbang po rnam par smin pa las skyes pa sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yid kyi dbang po rnam par smin pa las skyes pa sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When the maturational mental faculty is concomitant with pain,üîΩ

original: bde 'gro 'am ngan 'gro na nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro 'am ngan 'gro na nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: When the faculty of mind is concomitant with pain, it is the karmic maturation of misconduct in a happy or an unhappy migratory state.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par smin pa las skyes pa bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni dge ba'i yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par smin pa las skyes pa bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni dge ba'i yin no //

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ni dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dag ma gtogs pa'i bde 'gro'am ngan 'gro na'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ni dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dag ma gtogs pa'i bde 'gro'am ngan 'gro na'o //
translated: The faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure, and equanimity are the karmic maturation of virtue in a happy migratory state or in an unhappy migratory state, except in the hells.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'i mi dge ba ni zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'i mi dge ba ni zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu'o //
translated: The faculty of pain is the karmic maturation of nonvirtue in a happy or an unhappy migratory state.

analyzed: brgyad pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa rnams ni bde 'gro na ni dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin la zhes bshad na /

original: mtshan gnyis pa'i dbang po gnyis bde 'gro na dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa'i dbang po gnyis bde 'gro na dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ji ltar yin zhe na /

analyzed: bde 'gro ste mi dag @162b gi nang nas mi dge ba'i las kyis dbang po gnyis po de rjes su mi 'tsham pa'i gnas su rnyed pa yin te /

original: de ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: de ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed do //
translated: That is an unwholesome nonmental factor.

original: dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dge ba kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: dbang po ni lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dge ba kho na'i yin te /

original: lus kyi dbang po bzhin du bde 'gro na gcig tu dge ba kho na'i rnam par smin pa yin no //

translated: In the K·πõtamƒÅlƒÅ S≈´tra, the cause of the indeterminate and uncontaminated is taught to be the non-maturation of karma.

original: ji ltar mtha' gcig tu rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa nyid mtha' dag gi rgyu ma yin pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mtha' gcig tu rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa nyid mtha' dag gi rgyu ma yin pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: How is it that maturation is not the cause of all?üîΩWhy is it that only mental dissatisfaction has maturation, but the others do not?

analyzed: de'i (gsal ba tha dag/) / phyir de ni lung du ma bstan pa yang med la zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste //
translated: Because of that, it is said that there is no indeterminate and so on.

original: sa bon rul ba bzhin lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin la /üîΩzag pa @163a * //
analyzed: sa bon rul ba bzhin lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin la /üîΩzag pa @163a * //
translated: Indeterminate states are like rotten seeds, which do not have maturation.üîΩContaminated states are like seeds that are not rotten, which have maturation.

original: med pa yang sa bon grung po rlan gyi sa ma brlan pa ltar sra bas ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: med pa yang sa bon grung po rlan gyi sa ma brlan pa ltar sra bas ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa yin zhing /
translated: Also, it is not a ripened result because it is not moistened by solidity, like a moist seed that is not moistened by water.

original: yid mi bde ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is a ripened result because it is contaminated virtue and nonvirtue.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is not equipoise.

original: zag pa med pa nyid kyis med pa la rgyu smras pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa nyid kyis med pa la rgyu smras pa ste /
translated: This is the reason for the nonexistence of uncontaminated states.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i zag pa med pa 'dus byas ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i zag pa med pa 'dus byas ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Uncontaminated states that are conditioned do not exist in the formless realm because they are not equipoise.üîΩThe ten are of two types.

original: bcu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la bcu kho na rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes nges par gzung bas gzhan rnam pa gcig go zhes bya ba grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la bcu kho na rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes nges par gzung bas gzhan rnam pa gcig go zhes bya ba grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe ten are of two types‚Äù is a restrictive statement that establishes that the other faculties are of one type.

original: gzhan ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam par smin pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: The other faculties are established as being without result.

original: gzhan gang zhe na dbang po bcu gcig go //
analyzed: gzhan gang zhe na dbang po bcu gcig go //
translated: What are the other faculties? They are the eleven faculties.

original: de la mig la sogs pa dang / brgyad pa srog dang ldan pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ni zag pa med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa dang / brgyad pa srog dang ldan pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ni zag pa med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med pa'o //
translated: The eight faculties beginning with the eye and the vitality faculty are not karmic maturation because they are indeterminate. The three beginning with the faculty of understanding all are not karmic maturation because they are uncontaminated.

original: dge ba brgyad ces bya ba ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ste /
analyzed: dge ba brgyad ces bya ba ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par bzung ste /
translated: The eight that are virtuous are definitely virtuous because they are concomitant with nonattachment and so on.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the others are also virtuous.

original: yid mi bde ba rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is twofold.

original: yid mi bde ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kho na'o //üîΩyid dang tshor gzhan ni rnam gsum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kho na'o // yid dang tshor gzhan ni rnam gsum zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is definitely twofold because it is both karmic maturation and concomitant with affliction.üîΩThe others are threefold.

original: tshor gzhan zhes smos pa ni yid mi bde ba las gzhan pa'i tshor ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: tshor gzhan zhes smos pa ni yid mi bde ba las gzhan pa'i tshor ba gzung ngo //
translated: The others are the mental faculty and the other feelings, which are definitely threefold because they are both karmic maturation and concomitant with affliction.

original: dbang po lnga po 'di dag dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga po 'di dag dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: The five sense faculties are wholesome when they are associated with the roots of wholesomeness.

original: mi dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: They are unwholesome when they are associated with the roots of unwholesomeness.

original: de dag las gzhan pa rnam par smin pa las /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa rnam par smin pa las /
translated: The others, i.e., those that are arisen from the ripening cause,

original: skyes pa dang / spyod lam dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa ba dag ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: skyes pa dang / spyod lam dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa ba dag ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: those that are in the realm of deportment, those that are in the realm of skill in arts and crafts, and those that are in the realm of emanation, are indeterminate.

original: gzhan ni rnam pa gcig ces bya bar nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam pa gcig ces bya bar nges par gzung ngo //
translated: The others are of one type.üîΩIf the root text did not specify that the five sense faculties are of one type, then one might wonder whether they are of one type or of two types.

original: nges par ma bzung na ni cir 'gyur zhe na ci rnam pa gcig yin nam rnam pa gnyis yin snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par ma bzung na ni cir 'gyur zhe na ci rnam pa gcig yin nam rnam pa gnyis yin snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the root text did specify that they are of one type, one might still wonder whether they are of one type or of two types.

original: de lta na yang the tshom za ba kho na'o ci zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang the tshom za ba kho na'o ci zhe na /
translated: What is the problem?

original: dge ba'am mi dge ba'am /üîΩlung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'am mi dge ba'am / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Are they wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate?üîΩThe five sense faculties are indeterminate.

original: lung du ma bstan brgyad dag nyid //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan brgyad dag nyid //

analyzed: lnga po ni spang bar bya ba min yang zhes bya ba la / @165a * // yang gi sgra ni yod pa'i phyir dang skabs su bab pa'i phyir dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag kyang ma yin zhes bya bar shes so // zag pa med pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag yin la /
translated: The five are not objects to be abandoned,

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //

original: gsum min zhes bya ba la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gang du yang ni spang bya ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gsum min zhes bya ba la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gang du yang ni spang bya ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: The faculty producing complete knowledge and the other two are not objects to be abandoned in any way,

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are uncontaminated and there is no fault.

original: gal te gzings lta bu'i chos kyi rnam grangs las lam yang spang bar bya ba nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩgsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te gzings lta bu'i chos kyi rnam grangs las lam yang spang bar bya ba nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na / gsungs mod kyi /

analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dag gis ni spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: it is said to be abandoned, but it is not abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation.üîΩIt is said to be abandoned when one enters the realm of nirvana without

analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa'i tshe gtong bas spang ba zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: khams gang du dang po nyid du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: In which realm is the first of all?

original: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba kho na dang por rnyed pa dris pa la sogs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba kho na dang por rnyed pa dris pa la sogs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the point of asking about the first acquisition of the karmic maturation of the eye?

analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i sems nyid kyi nyid mtshams sbyor ba gsal bar bya'o // 'dod par dang por rnam smin gnyis //
translated: It is to clarify the linking of a nonafflicted mind.üîΩIn the desire realm, two karmic maturations

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: are first acquired.

original: dang por zhes bya ba ci'i don du yin zhe na /
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba ci'i don du yin zhe na /
translated: What is the point of the word first?

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po rnam par smin pas bsdus pa rnams phyis rim gyis rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po rnam par smin pas bsdus pa rnams phyis rim gyis rnyed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon de'i tshe kho na rnyed par 'thad do //

analyzed: ji ltar lus kyi dbang po de'i tshe rang gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa de ltar mig la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The body sense faculty at that time is the cause that generates its own consciousness, but the eye sense faculty and so on are not.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnyis zhes brjod par gang yin pa de dag ni dmus long la sogs pa la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnyis zhes brjod par gang yin pa de dag ni dmus long la sogs pa la yang sbyar ro //

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /üîΩda ni de ltar mi brjod de //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re / da ni de ltar mi brjod de //
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

analyzed: rdzus te skye bas min zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rdzus te skye ba rnams ni dbang po tshang bar skye ba'i phyir ci phyir yid dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag ma yin zhe na rnam par smin pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can // zhes bya ba'i ngag des gdon mi za bar nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur la /

original: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //üîΩdad pa la sogs pa rnams kyang de'i tshe rnyed mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no // dad pa la sogs pa rnams kyang de'i tshe rnyed mod kyi /
translated: Retribution is morally nondefined.

original: de dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par @165b smin pa ni ma yin no //üîΩnur nur po la sogs pa'i gzugs dbang po ma yin pa'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyang de'i tshe rnyed mod kyi /
analyzed: de dge ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par @165b smin pa ni ma yin no // nur nur po la sogs pa'i gzugs dbang po ma yin pa'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyang de'i tshe rnyed mod kyi /
translated: Faith and the other faculties are acquired at this stage, but they are not retribution, because they are good.

original: de dag 'di ni ma smos te dbang po'i skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'di ni ma smos te dbang po'i skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The material form of the embryonic stages, which is retribution, is also acquired at this stage, but it is not mentioned here, because the present discussion concerns the faculties.

original: yang rdzus te skye bdag gis du zhig 'thob ce na /
analyzed: yang rdzus te skye bdag gis du zhig 'thob ce na /
translated: How many faculties does one possess in the intermediate existence?

original: 'dod pa dag tu dang por zhes sbyar ro ;
analyzed: 'dod pa dag tu dang por zhes sbyar ro ;
translated: The first in the desire realm.üîΩIf they are sexless,

original: / gal te mtshan med pa zhig yin na ste zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gal te mtshan med pa zhig yin na ste zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is, if they do not have the male or female faculty.

analyzed: pho dang mo nyid du mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po la mtshan zhes brjod do //
translated: The male and female faculties are called sex because they manifest as the characteristics of masculinity and femininity.

original: rdzus te skye ba mtshan med pa rnams da lta med pas 'dir bskal pa dang po ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba mtshan med pa rnams da lta med pas 'dir bskal pa dang po ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since those born supernaturally who are sexless do not exist now, he says, for example, those in the first eon.

original: mtshan gcig pa zhig yin na ste //
analyzed: mtshan gcig pa zhig yin na ste //
translated: If they have one sex,

original: zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po gang yang rung ba zhig med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po gang yang rung ba zhig med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is, if they do not have either the male or female faculty.

original: mi rnams kyi nang na da lta rdzus te skye ba med pas 'di ltar lha la sogs pa na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang na da lta rdzus te skye ba med pas 'di ltar lha la sogs pa na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since those born supernaturally do not exist now among humans, he says, for example, among gods and so on.

original: 'di ni skye gnas khyad par du 'phags pa yin no zhes bya bar mthong ste ;
analyzed: 'di ni skye gnas khyad par du 'phags pa yin no zhes bya bar mthong ste ;
translated: This is the superior mode of birth.

original: 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is

original: ci rdzus te skye ba yang mtshan gnyis pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ci rdzus te skye ba yang mtshan gnyis pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Are those born supernaturally also called ‚Äúhaving two organs‚Äù?

original: 'dod pa'i sgra ni yul dag gam yul gyi 'dod chags la 'jug gi khams la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra ni yul dag gam yul gyi 'dod chags la 'jug gi khams la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The term ‚Äúdesire‚Äù refers to objects or attachment to objects, not to the realm.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te 'dod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te 'dod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams yin la /
translated: Therefore he says in detail, because desire is primary. Desire refers to objects such as form,

original: de gtso bor gyur pa ni 'dod pa'i khams yin te de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de gtso bor gyur pa ni 'dod pa'i khams yin te de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams zhes bstan to //
translated: and the desire realm is primary, hence it is called the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams gnyi ga gzugs yod pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du gzugs kyi khams kho na gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgras ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams gnyi ga gzugs yod pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du gzugs kyi khams kho na gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgras ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: Although both the desire realm and the form realm are similar in having form, why is the form realm alone called form?

original: de'i phyir gzugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore he says in detail, because form is primary.

original: gzugs de ni dad pa yin pa'i phyir dang 'od can yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: gzugs de ni dad pa yin pa'i phyir dang 'od can yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
translated: Form is primary because it is faith and it is luminous.

original: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba 'dis ni mdo las gzugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi sgras gzugs kyi khams gsungs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba 'dis ni mdo las gzugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi sgras gzugs kyi khams gsungs so zhes ston to //
translated: The phrase also in the sutras indicates that the form realm is called the form realm in the sutras because form is primary there.

original: gong mar gcig ces bya ba la gzugs med pa'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams pas gong ma yin no //
analyzed: gong mar gcig ces bya ba la gzugs med pa'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams pas gong ma yin no //
translated: The phrase the formless realm is higher means that the formless realm is higher than the form realm.

original: yul ni mi gnas pas gzugs med pa'i khams gzugs kyi khams pas gong mar ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: yul ni mi gnas pas gzugs med pa'i khams gzugs kyi khams pas gong mar ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: But how can the formless realm be said to be higher than the form realm if it does not exist in a specific place?

original: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pas ring ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir @166a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pas ring ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te / gang gi phyir @166a * //

analyzed: gzugs su snyoms par 'jug pa ni snga la gzugs med par snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'phyi ba yin no //
translated: Because the meditative attainment of the form realm precedes the meditative attainment of the formless realm.

original: de ltar snga phyi nyid kyis yin gyi 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams ltar yul na gnas pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar snga phyi nyid kyis yin gyi 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams ltar yul na gnas pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is distant in this way due to being prior and subsequent, not due to existing in a specific place like the desire realm and form realm.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs med pa'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams bas skye pas ches mchog yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs med pa'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams bas skye pas ches mchog yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: It is also superior to the form realm because the formless realm is superior to the form realm in terms of birth.

original: der ni bskal pa stong phrag mang por ches rab tu zhi ba rnam par smin par 'gyur te de'i phyir yang gong ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni bskal pa stong phrag mang por ches rab tu zhi ba rnam par smin par 'gyur te de'i phyir yang gong ma yin no //
translated: The karmic maturation of the formless realm is extremely peaceful, because it is the karmic maturation of karma that is extremely peaceful for many thousands of eons.

original: srog gi dbang po gcig pu kho na dang por rnam par smin pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gcig pu kho na dang por rnam par smin pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The single faculty of life force is the first to mature.

original: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnams ma yin la /
analyzed: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnams ma yin la /
translated: The faculties of the eyes and so on do not exist there because there is no form there.

original: dge ba dang nyon mongs ba can yin pa'i phyir gzhan rnams kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang nyon mongs ba can yin pa'i phyir gzhan rnams kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor do the others exist there because they are virtuous or afflicted.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: srog gi dbang po rdzas su yod pa nyid kyis shes bar byed pa ni 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po rdzas su yod pa nyid kyis shes bar byed pa ni 'di kho na yin te /
translated: This alone is the proof that the faculty of life force exists as a substance.

original: de med na gang rnyed pas gzugs med pa dag tu skyes pa zhes bya /
analyzed: de med na gang rnyed pas gzugs med pa dag tu skyes pa zhes bya /
translated: If it did not exist, then when would one be said to be born in the formless realm?

original: dge ba nyon mongs pa can ni de skye ba'i las kyi 'bras bu ma yin la /
analyzed: dge ba nyon mongs pa can ni de skye ba'i las kyi 'bras bu ma yin la /
translated: A virtuous or afflicted mind is not the result of karma that generates it.

original: skye ba med par yang de mngon du gyur pa srid pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i sems kyis mtshams sbyor ba yang mi rigs la /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis skye bar nying mtshams sbyor bar khas blangs pa'i phyir na rnam par smin pa dang 'brel ba med par skye ba yang ma rigs pa de'i phyir gdon mi za bar skye ba'i rtags su gyur pa chos gzhan zhig khas blang bar
analyzed: skye ba med par yang de mngon du gyur pa srid pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i sems kyis mtshams sbyor ba yang mi rigs la / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis skye bar nying mtshams sbyor bar khas blangs pa'i phyir na rnam par smin pa dang 'brel ba med par skye ba yang ma rigs pa de'i phyir gdon mi za bar skye ba'i rtags su gyur pa chos gzhan zhig khas blang bar
translated: It is also illogical that the mind of karmic maturation links with the intermediate existence because it is possible that it manifests as the state of nonarising.üîΩIt is also illogical that birth occurs without being related to karmic maturation because it is accepted that birth is linked with the afflicted mind.

original: bya dgos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bya dgos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to accept that there is another phenomenon that is the sign of birth.

original: gzugs med dag tu 'chi ba ni //
analyzed: gzugs med dag tu 'chi ba ni //
translated: Death in the formless realmüîΩis through degeneration of the mind.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni srog dang yid dang / btang snyoms rnams phan tshun mi gtong ba'i phyir te /üîΩbtang snyoms dang ni sogs dang ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni srog dang yid dang / btang snyoms rnams phan tshun mi gtong ba'i phyir te / btang snyoms dang ni sogs dang ni //
translated: The life force, the mind and equanimity do not mutually relinquish each other.üîΩAs it is said,üîΩThe mind possessing equanimity

original: yid dang ldan la nges gsum ldan //üîΩzhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid dang ldan la nges gsum ldan //üîΩzhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and so on definitely possesses three.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba la dad pa la sogs pa med pas gzugs med pa'i khams su 'chi ba na gdon mi za ba'i gsum po de dag 'gag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba la dad pa la sogs pa med pas gzugs med pa'i khams su 'chi ba na gdon mi za ba'i gsum po de dag 'gag go //
translated: When one dies in the formless realm, the three certainties necessarily cease, because faith and so on do not exist in a defiled or neutral mind.

original: gnyis kyang zhes bya ba'i tshig phrad dag gis gnyis ka don gcig ste /
analyzed: gnyis kyang zhes bya ba'i tshig phrad dag gis gnyis ka don gcig ste /
translated: The two words ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicate that both are the same.

original: snga mas ni tshor ba nges par 'dzin to //
analyzed: snga mas ni tshor ba nges par 'dzin to //
translated: The first ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that feeling is ascertained.

original: 'og mas ni gzugs can 'gag pa 'gog ste /
analyzed: 'og mas ni gzugs can 'gag pa 'gog ste /
translated: The second ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that form ceases.

original: kha cig na re de na gzugs yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re de na gzugs yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that form exists there.

original: mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi dngos po la rnam par smin pa'i rgyud gang yin pa rnam par gcad pas @166b gzugs med pa rnams nas 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya ste /

translated: The formless realm is so called because the continuum of karmic maturation is eliminated there, in the state of non-associated formative factors.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi dge ba nyon mongs pa can mngon du gyur na 'chi 'phos par thal ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi dge ba nyon mongs pa can mngon du gyur na 'chi 'phos par thal ba med do //
translated: When the four virtuous and afflicted aggregates that are not derived from karmic maturation manifest, it is not the case that death and rebirth necessarily occur.

original: yongs su zad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i sa pa'i rnam par smin pa nyon mongs pa can gyis dge ba'i sems so //
analyzed: yongs su zad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i sa pa'i rnam par smin pa nyon mongs pa can gyis dge ba'i sems so //
translated: because it would follow that it would be completely exhausted.

original: de la las gang /
analyzed: de la las gang /
translated: What is the action?

original: de'i rnam par smin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is its retribution?

original: so sor myong ba dang mngon du ma gyur par so sor myong bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: so sor myong ba dang mngon du ma gyur par so sor myong bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is the production of a wholesome thought of the same stage as the defiled thought, which is experienced either in the present life or in a later life.

original: gal te rnam par smin pas bsgos pa mi 'thad pa'i skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pas bsgos pa mi 'thad pa'i skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the objection does not hold because it is not tenable that the retribution is perfumed,
