analyzed: las kyis bsgos pa bzhin yongs su zad pa la yang rnam par smin pa de bsgos pa mi 'thad pa nyid kyis 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, like the action, the retribution would be exhausted without being perfumed.

original: gal te rnam par smin pa yongs su ma zad pas bsgos pa yod do zhe na /üîΩlas su yang ma gyur pa de'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pas bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa yongs su ma zad pas bsgos pa yod do zhe na / las su yang ma gyur pa de'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pas bsgos pa'o //
translated: If you say that the retribution is perfumed because it is not exhausted,üîΩthen it would not be the retribution because it would not be the result of the action.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rjes su mi 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rjes su mi 'jug go //
translated: The retribution is not perfumed because it is not homogeneous.

original: 'bras bu tshad med pa ni las kyis bsgos pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshad med pa ni las kyis bsgos pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The immeasurable result is the result that is similar to the cause that is infused by karma.

original: tshad yod pa'i phyir las rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad yod pa'i phyir las rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: Karma is not like that, because it is measurable.

original: zad pa yod pas na las kyi bag chags bzlog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zad pa yod pas na las kyi bag chags bzlog pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it has an end, the latent impressions of karma are not reversed.

original: ji ltar rnam par smin pa zad pa las de ma thob par las zad pa las rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par smin pa zad pa las de ma thob par las zad pa las rnams ma yin no //
translated: Just as the karma that has not yet been obtained from the exhaustion of the ripening is not exhausted,

original: de bzhin du rnam bar smin pa zad pa la rnam par smin pas bsgos pa'i phyir bzlog pa ni las zad pa la las rnams ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam bar smin pa zad pa la rnam par smin pas bsgos pa'i phyir bzlog pa ni las zad pa la las rnams ma yin no zhes so //
translated: in the same way, the karma that has not been reversed from the exhaustion of the ripening is not exhausted from the exhaustion of the ripening, because it is infused by the ripening.

original: rnam par smin pas bsgos pa rjes su 'jug pa ni rnam par smin pa myong bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pas bsgos pa rjes su 'jug pa ni rnam par smin pa myong bar mi rigs so //
translated: The infusion of the ripening does not follow the experience of the ripening.

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i bag chags rjes su 'jug pa nyid rnam par smin pa myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i bag chags rjes su 'jug pa nyid rnam par smin pa myong ba ma yin no //
translated: The latent impressions of the ripening do not follow the experience of the ripening, because they are not of the nature of the ripening.

original: de'i 'bras bu myong ba ni rnam par smin pa myong ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu myong ba ni rnam par smin pa myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of its result is the experience of the ripening.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams su rdzas gzhan med kyang rnam par smin pa'i bag chags rjes su 'jug pa mngon du gyur kyang 'chi 'pho bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams su rdzas gzhan med kyang rnam par smin pa'i bag chags rjes su 'jug pa mngon du gyur kyang 'chi 'pho bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, although there is no other substance in the formless realm, when the latent tendencies of karmic maturation are activated, there is no death.

original: de las bzlog pa ni 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when they are not activated, there is death.

original: gzugs na brgyad dag 'gag go //
analyzed: gzugs na brgyad dag 'gag go //
translated: Eight faculties cease in the form realm.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni //
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: rdzus te skye ba thams cad ni //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba thams cad ni //
translated: All beings born supernaturally

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: have complete faculties.

original: rdzus te skye ba rnams la mer mer po la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir dang / rim gyis 'chi ba med pa'i phyir dbang po tshang ba rnams skye zhing 'chi ba yin no //üîΩ'dod par bcu'am dgu'am brgyad //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba rnams la mer mer po la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir dang / rim gyis 'chi ba med pa'i phyir dbang po tshang ba rnams skye zhing 'chi ba yin no // 'dod par bcu'am dgu'am brgyad //
translated: Because those born supernaturally do not have the stages of kalala and so on and because they do not die gradually, they are born and die with complete faculties.

original: ces bya ba la /üîΩmtshan gnyis pa dbang po tshang ba @167a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba la / mtshan gnyis pa dbang po tshang ba @167a * //
translated: Ten, nine, or eight cease in the desire realm.

original: zhig yin na ni bcu 'gag go //
analyzed: zhig yin na ni bcu 'gag go //
translated: If one with two organs has complete faculties, ten cease.

original: mtshan gcig pa zhig yin na ni //
analyzed: mtshan gcig pa zhig yin na ni //
translated: If one has one organ,

original: zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig dang ldan ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig dang ldan ba'o //
translated: Those possessing either a male or female organ possess ten faculties.

original: mtshan med pa ni de gnyis ka dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan med pa ni de gnyis ka dang bral ba'o //
translated: Those lacking both organs are said to be sexless.

original: cig car 'chi ba la ni /
analyzed: cig car 'chi ba la ni /
translated: Those who die suddenly

original: 'dod par bcu'am dgu /
analyzed: 'dod par bcu'am dgu /
translated: possess ten or nine faculties.üîΩThose who die gradually possess eight.

original: brgyad ces bya ba tshul de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: brgyad ces bya ba tshul de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the rule.

original: rim gyis 'chi ba dag la zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: rim gyis 'chi ba dag la zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: From what is this known?üîΩFrom the immediately following statement:

original: rim gyis 'chi bdag la bzhi zhes mjug thogs su 'chad pa las so //
analyzed: rim gyis 'chi bdag la bzhi zhes mjug thogs su 'chad pa las so //
translated: Those who die gradually possess four.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams sngar 'gags zin pa'i phyir dang / lus dang / srog dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / btang snyoms rnams phan tshun mi 'dor bas so sor 'gag ba ma yin pa de'i phyir rim gyis 'chi bdag la bzhi 'gag go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams sngar 'gags zin pa'i phyir dang / lus dang / srog dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / btang snyoms rnams phan tshun mi 'dor bas so sor 'gag ba ma yin pa de'i phyir rim gyis 'chi bdag la bzhi 'gag go //
translated: The faculties of the eyes and so on cease earlier because they are not mutually exclusive. The faculties of the body, life force, mind and equanimity do not cease individually because they are mutually exclusive. Therefore, those who die gradually possess four faculties at the end.

original: tshul de lta bu yin par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: tshul de lta bu yin par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: This is the rule.

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa'i sems ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa'i sems ni gsum ste /
translated: The mind of death exists in three ways.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang dge ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang dge ba'o //
translated: defiled, indeterminate, and virtuous.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can dang ; lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba la ni ji skad bshad pa'i dbang po 'gag par rig par bya ste dbang po gzhan med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can dang ; lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba la ni ji skad bshad pa'i dbang po 'gag par rig par bya ste dbang po gzhan med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In regard to that, it should be understood that the faculties cease as explained in the case of death with a defiled or indeterminate mind, because there are no other faculties.

original: dge la thams cad dag tu lnga //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge la thams cad dag tu lnga // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In virtue, all five.

original: thams cad dag tu zhes bya ba ni khams gsum char gyi 'chi ba la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad dag tu zhes bya ba ni khams gsum char gyi 'chi ba la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In all cases means in the case of death in all three realms.

original: dge ba la ni gdon mi za bar dad pa la sogs pa lnga po 'gag ste /
analyzed: dge ba la ni gdon mi za bar dad pa la sogs pa lnga po 'gag ste /
translated: In virtue, the five such as faith definitely cease.

original: dad po la sogs pa rnams ni dge ba'i sems la nges par yod ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad po la sogs pa rnams ni dge ba'i sems la nges par yod ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the five such as faith definitely exist in a virtuous mind.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'ang 'gag go zhes shes par byed do //
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'ang 'gag go zhes shes par byed do //
translated: The word also indicates that those previously mentioned also cease.üîΩIt should be calculated in detail.

original: rgyas par brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na cig car 'ching la bco lnga'am /
analyzed: rgyas par brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na cig car 'ching la bco lnga'am /
translated: In the desire realm, fifteen cease simultaneously in one who is bound to all realms.

original: bcu bzhi'am / bcu gsum yin la /
analyzed: bcu bzhi'am / bcu gsum yin la /
translated: or thirteen.

original: rim gyis 'chi ba dag la dgu zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdbang po'i skabs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rim gyis 'chi ba dag la dgu zhes bya ba'o // dbang po'i skabs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If one dies gradually, it is said that there are nine.

original: chos rab tu rnam par dbye bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos brtsams pas /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par dbye bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos brtsams pas /
translated: The treatise was composed in order to thoroughly discern the dharmas.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i skabs su dbang po'i chos thams cad dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i skabs su dbang po'i chos thams cad dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in the section on the faculties, all the dharmas of the faculties should be investigated.

original: dge sbyong tshul gyis 'bras bu rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong tshul gyis 'bras bu rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: The results of the ≈õrama·πáa are extensively explained.

original: dbang po ma yin pa dag gis kyang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnams 'thob mod kyi /
analyzed: dbang po ma yin pa dag gis kyang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnams 'thob mod kyi /
translated: Although the results of the ≈õrama·πáa are obtained by those who are not faculties,

original: dbang po rnams kyi skabs su bab pa de'i phyir de rnams kho na dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi skabs su bab pa de'i phyir de rnams kho na dpyad par bya'o //
translated: since the faculties are the topic, only they should be investigated.

original: 'bras bu tha ma gnyis dgus 'thob //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha ma gnyis dgus 'thob //
translated: The last two results are obtained by nine.

original: ces bya ba dgu kho nas zhes nges par gzung @167b ngo ;
analyzed: ces bya ba dgu kho nas zhes nges par gzung @167b ngo ;
translated: Only nine is a restrictive enumeration.

original: / bstan bcos las ni gang zag 'bras bu thams cad thob pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'don to //
analyzed: / bstan bcos las ni gang zag 'bras bu thams cad thob pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'don to //
translated: The treatise mentions them from the perspective of the person who obtains all the results.

original: mtha' na yod pa'i phyir rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa dag gi mtha' ma'o //
analyzed: mtha' na yod pa'i phyir rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa dag gi mtha' ma'o //
translated: Because it is the end, it is the end of the fruit of stream-entry and of the arhat.

original: de gnyis kyi bar yin pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dag ni bar ma'o //üîΩde la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni zhes bya rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bar yin pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dag ni bar ma'o // de la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni zhes bya rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is in between those two, the once-returner and non-returner are in between.üîΩThe fruit of stream-entry is the fruit of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni mthong ba dang bsgom ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu yin ba'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa dang / kun shes ba dang ldan pa'i dbang po ma gtogs pa dag dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni mthong ba dang bsgom ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu yin ba'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa dang / kun shes ba dang ldan pa'i dbang po ma gtogs pa dag dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the faculties of faith and so on, and the faculty of final and perfect knowledge are excluded.

original: de la dge ba yin pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa rnams yod do //
analyzed: de la dge ba yin pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa rnams yod do //
translated: Because it is virtuous, the faculties of faith and so on exist there.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa mthong ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir de na kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yod do //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa mthong ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir de na kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yod do //
translated: Because the path of seeing is the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, the faculty of final and perfect knowledge exists there.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pas de na kun shes pa'i dbang po yod do //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pas de na kun shes pa'i dbang po yod do //
translated: The faculty of complete knowledge exists on the path of knowing the subsequent because it is the path of meditation.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam ni mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang / de na tshor ba btang snyoms kho na yod pas btang snyoms kyi dbang po yang yod do //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam ni mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang / de na tshor ba btang snyoms kho na yod pas btang snyoms kyi dbang po yang yod do //
translated: The faculty of equanimity exists on the path of stream entry because the path of stream entry is subsumed by unrestricted access concentration and because only the feeling of equanimity exists there.

original: de na yod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: de na yod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The consciousness that exists there is the mental faculty.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam la'o //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam la'o //
translated: Acceptance of knowing the subsequent is the uninterrupted path.

original: rjes su shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam la'o //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam la'o //
translated: Subsequent knowing is the liberated path.

original: gnyis pas kyang zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gnyis kas so //
analyzed: gnyis pas kyang zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gnyis kas so //
translated: Also by the second means by both the uninterrupted path and the liberated path.

original: de 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: One obtains that means one obtains the result of stream entry.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: bral ba'i thob pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bral ba'i thob pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The obtainment of separation from the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The uninterrupted path is the path that leads to liberation.üîΩ

original: bral ba'i thob pa skye ba'i gegs su gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba'i thob pa skye ba'i gegs su gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uninterrupted path is the guide because it severs the obtainment of affliction that obstructs the arising of the obtainment of separation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bral ba'i thob pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bral ba'i thob pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore the obtainment of separation is the natural outflow and the result of conscious effort of the uninterrupted path.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu bral ba'i thob pa skye ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam ni bral ba'i thob pa'i rten nyid yin no //üîΩde ltar na bral ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma yin cing /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu bral ba'i thob pa skye ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam ni bral ba'i thob pa'i rten nyid yin no // de ltar na bral ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma yin cing /
translated: The liberated path is the support of the obtainment of separation because the obtainment of separation arises simultaneously with the liberated path.

original: de thob ba'i yang ma yin na /
analyzed: de thob ba'i yang ma yin na /
translated: Thus separation is not the result of the liberated path, nor is it obtained by it.

original: ji ltar kun shes pa'i dbang pos rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo zhes brjod ce na /üîΩbar chad med ba'i lam rnams ni rnam par @168a * //
analyzed: ji ltar kun shes pa'i dbang pos rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo zhes brjod ce na / bar chad med ba'i lam rnams ni rnam par @168a * //
translated: If that is so, then how can it be said that the faculty of complete knowledge obtains the result of stream enterer?

original: grol ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the uninterrupted path is the retinue of the liberated path.

original: rgyal po'i 'khor gyis byas pa rgyal po la nye bar 'dogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i 'khor gyis byas pa rgyal po la nye bar 'dogs pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, the retinue of a king is figuratively designated as the king.

original: de bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam gyis byas pa rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams la nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam gyis byas pa rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams la nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Similarly, the liberated paths are figuratively designated as the result of the uninterrupted paths.

original: nub phyogs pa rnams na re /
analyzed: nub phyogs pa rnams na re /
translated: Some say:

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang lhan cig bral ba'i thos pa mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang lhan cig bral ba'i thos pa mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The liberated paths are the result of the uninterrupted paths because they manifest the obtainment of freedom that is generated by the uninterrupted paths.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: bral ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bral ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is not so because it would then follow that freedom would be the result of the uninterrupted path.

original: de nyid la smras pa /üîΩ'dod pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i nges pas dge sbyong tshul gyis 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams kyi 'bras bur mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid la smras pa / 'dod pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i nges pas dge sbyong tshul gyis 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams kyi 'bras bur mi rung ngo //
translated: In response to that, it is said:üîΩThe result of the liberated paths is not suitable to be the result of the paths of seeing and so on because they are homogeneous causes of the desire realm.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i nges pas ni ma yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i nges pas ni ma yin pas skyon med do //
translated: But it is not that they are not the result of the liberated paths because they are concomitant and coemergent causes.

original: phan tshun gegs bskyed pa rnams ni dge sbyong tshul gyi bdag nyid phan tshun skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa cis zlog par byed do //
analyzed: phan tshun gegs bskyed pa rnams ni dge sbyong tshul gyi bdag nyid phan tshun skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa cis zlog par byed do //
translated: Why do you reject that mutual obstruction is the result of conscious effort of the nature of the way of virtuous endeavor?

original: gal te sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang khyad par gyi lam rnams kyang der thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang khyad par gyi lam rnams kyang der thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the paths of preparation, immediate succession, and distinctive feature would also be the result of conscious effort,

original: de ltar byas na skyon med do /
analyzed: de ltar byas na skyon med do /
translated: then there is no error in our position.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i nges pas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu kun shes pa'i dbang pos 'thob bo //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i nges pas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu kun shes pa'i dbang pos 'thob bo //
translated: The result of stream entry is obtained by the faculty of final and perfect knowledge, which is a homogeneous cause.

original: de dbang po 'pho ba'i dus su zhes bya ba srid par mngon par brjod pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa nyid bzhin skyon med do //
analyzed: de dbang po 'pho ba'i dus su zhes bya ba srid par mngon par brjod pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa nyid bzhin skyon med do //
translated: There is no error in our position, because we are speaking hypothetically, as in the case of arhatship.

original: 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas bar chad med pa'i lam rnams dge sbyor tshul gyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //

analyzed: zag pa med pa'i @171b phyir so so skye bo dang mi ldan no //
translated: One who is not accompanied by the faculty producing complete knowledge is not accompanied by the faculty of producing complete knowledge, because he is an ordinary being.

original: mthong ba'i lam btang ba'i phyir 'bras bu la gnas pa dang mi ldan no //üîΩkun shes pa'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la /üîΩzag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /

translated: One who has relinquished the path of seeing is not accompanied by the faculty of complete knowledge, because he is a person who abides in a result.üîΩOne who is not accompanied by the faculty of complete knowledge is not accompanied by the faculty of possessing complete knowledge, because he is an ordinary being, or because he is a person abiding on the path of seeing or the path of no-more-learning.

original: so so'i skye bo dang / mthong ba dang / mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams mi ldan no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / mthong ba dang / mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams mi ldan no //
translated: One who is not accompanied by the faculty of possessing complete knowledge is not accompanied by the faculty of possessing complete knowledge, because he is an ordinary being, or because he is a person abiding on the path of seeing or the path of no-more-learning.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la mi slob pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dag mi ldan no //

original: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang ni 'dod ba dang // gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa dag dang ldan no //

analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar thob pa dang ma nyams pa ldan no //

original: bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'og tu skyes pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs par skyes pa'i 'phags pa ldan no //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'og tu skyes pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs par skyes pa'i 'phags pa ldan no //

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ldan no //

analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ldan no //

original: dad pa la sogs pa dag dang ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad pa ldan no //üîΩkun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ni mthong pa'i lam la gnas pa ldan no //

analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa ldan no //

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni mi slob ba'i lam la gnas pa dag ldan no //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni mi slob ba'i lam la gnas pa dag ldan no //

analyzed: de ltar na ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs de dag tu ni ji ltar bshad pa dang ldan par rig par bya'o //

original: bde lus ldan la bzhi dag dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde lus ldan la bzhi dag dang // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: yid bde ba dang ldan gyi mig la sogs pa dang ni ma yin no // 'dod @173a * //

translated: do not possess those not obtained or lost.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang / bzhi par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams pho dang mo'i dbang po dang mi ldan la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang / bzhi par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams pho dang mo'i dbang po dang mi ldan la /
translated: ƒÄryas born in the first, second, third, and fourth absorptions do not possess the male and female faculties.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa rnams kyi yang gang zhig lus kyi dbang po ma thob pa dang nyams bdag mi ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa rnams kyi yang gang zhig lus kyi dbang po ma thob pa dang nyams bdag mi ldan no //
translated: Those born in the desire realm do not possess those faculties of body, etc., that are not obtained or lost.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes ba'i 'phags pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis par skyes pa'i so so skye bo dag mi ldan no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes ba'i 'phags pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis par skyes pa'i so so skye bo dag mi ldan no //
translated: Noble ones born in the form and formless realms and ordinary beings born in the first and second absorptions do not possess the faculty of pain.

original: yid mi bde ba dang 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams mi ldan no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams mi ldan no //
translated: Those free of attachment to the desire realm do not possess mental dissatisfaction.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Faith and so on and the faculty producing complete knowledge and so on should be explained in the same way as the above.

original: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs rnams su ni ji skad bshad pa ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs rnams su ni ji skad bshad pa ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: They possess the faculties as explained in the context of those not prohibited.

original: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa bsam gtan gsum pa ma thob ba la lus kyi bde ba med cing sems kyi bde ba med de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa bsam gtan gsum pa ma thob ba la lus kyi bde ba med cing sems kyi bde ba med de /
translated: One born in the second absorption who has not obtained the third absorption does not possess physical pleasure and does not possess mental pleasure.

original: de'i phyir yid bde ba dang ldan pa ni mig la sogs pa ltar bde ba'i dbang po dang yang gdon mi za bar ldan pa ma yin no snyam du bsams te 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid bde ba dang ldan pa ni mig la sogs pa ltar bde ba'i dbang po dang yang gdon mi za bar ldan pa ma yin no snyam du bsams te 'dri ba ni /
translated: Therefore it is thought that mental satisfaction does not definitely possess the faculty of pleasure, like the eyes and so on.

original: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: One born in the second absorption possesses the affliction of the third absorption.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang ldan no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang ldan no zhes bya ba la /
translated: One born in the third absorption possesses the affliction of the fourth absorption.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i mi srid ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i mi srid ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is impossible for those of lower levels and because it is impossible for those of the third absorption to possess virtuous or neutral states,

original: de gnyis kyi phyir nyon mongs pa can dang ldan no zhes smos so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi phyir nyon mongs pa can dang ldan no zhes smos so //
translated: it is said that one possesses affliction.

original: de mi srid pa de de'i thob pa skye ba btang snyoms can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi srid pa de de'i thob pa skye ba btang snyoms can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is impossible because the obtainment of those is the equanimity of birth.

original: ji ltar sa gzhan dang ldan zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sa gzhan dang ldan zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: How could one possess other levels?

original: gal te sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa can nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa can nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that is because it is the affliction of a lower level,

original: mi mtshungs ba'i phyir nyon mongs ba can gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: mi mtshungs ba'i phyir nyon mongs ba can gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of affliction, since it is not similar?

original: gzugs med pa rnams las shin tu 'das pa'i 'phags pa ni ji ltar na bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang ldan zhes bya ba rgol ba'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams las shin tu 'das pa'i 'phags pa ni ji ltar na bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang ldan zhes bya ba rgol ba'i gzhi'o //
translated: How can ƒÅryas who transcend the formless realm possess pleasure and mental satisfaction?

original: gal te sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa sa 'og mar skyes ba dang mi ldan na /
analyzed: gal te sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa sa 'og mar skyes ba dang mi ldan na /
translated: If those born in lower levels do not possess the afflictions of higher levels,

original: 'o na spangs ba las 'dod ba la sogs par skyes pa bsam gtan la sogs pa la chags pa dang bral bar yongs su rtogs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na spangs ba las 'dod ba la sogs par skyes pa bsam gtan la sogs pa la chags pa dang bral bar yongs su rtogs pa ci zhe na /
translated: then how do you interpret the statement in the sutra that those born in the desire realm and so on realize freedom from attachment to the absorptions and so on?

original: spangs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba de'i phyir gdon mi @173b za bar sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: spangs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba de'i phyir gdon mi @173b za bar sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Because they abandon them, they are free from attachment. Therefore you must accept that they definitely possess the afflictions of higher levels.

original: gzhan du na de ni spangs pa med pa'i phyir sa gong ma la chags pa dang bral ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de ni spangs pa med pa'i phyir sa gong ma la chags pa dang bral ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because they would not abandon them, they would not be free from attachment to higher levels.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa can bzhin du ldan par mi rigs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa can bzhin du ldan par mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that those free of affliction possess affliction like those with affliction.

original: sbyor ba la rag las pa'i phyir dge ba dang ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba la rag las pa'i phyir dge ba dang ma yin te /
translated: They are not virtuous because they depend on preparation.

original: sbyor ba la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it is the cause of that.

original: skye bas thob pa dang yang ma yin te lhan cig skyes pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa dang yang ma yin te lhan cig skyes pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not obtained from birth, because it is obtained through practice.

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang ma yin te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang ma yin te /
translated: It is not neutral,

original: mtha' las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is beyond the extremes.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa'i lam btang ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang de'i rten las 'das pas mngon du ni mi byed de /
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa'i lam btang ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir bde ba dang yid bde ba dag dang de'i rten las 'das pas mngon du ni mi byed de /
translated: One does not manifest the faculty of pleasure and the faculty of mental pleasure, because the noble path of one born in the formless realm is not relinquished, and because the basis of those two has passed away.

original: sar gtogs pa ni sa gtong ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: sar gtogs pa ni sa gtong ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical to relinquish the stage to which one belongs.

original: sdug bsngal ldan ni gdon mi za bar ldan no zhes snyegs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ldan ni gdon mi za bar ldan no zhes snyegs te /
translated: One who possesses the faculty of pain definitely possesses it.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one who possesses the faculty of pain definitely possesses these faculties.

original: lhag ma ni ldan pa yang yod mi ldan pa yang yod do /
analyzed: lhag ma ni ldan pa yang yod mi ldan pa yang yod do /
translated: The remaining faculties are possessed or not possessed.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni mig la sogs pa dang ni ma thob pa dang nyams pa dag mi ldan no //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni mig la sogs pa dang ni ma thob pa dang nyams pa dag mi ldan no //
translated: One who possesses the faculty of pain does not possess the eyes, etc., that are not obtained or that have deteriorated.

original: de bzhin du pho dang mo'i dbang po dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du pho dang mo'i dbang po dag kyang ngo //
translated: The same applies to the male and female faculties.

original: yid mi bde ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba mi ldan no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba mi ldan no //
translated: One who is free from attachment is not accompanied by the faculty of dissatisfaction.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa mi ldan no //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa mi ldan no //
translated: One whose wholesome roots have been severed is not accompanied by the five faculties beginning with faith.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i khams su so so skye bo dang 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams mi ldan no //
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i khams su so so skye bo dang 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams mi ldan no //
translated: One who is an ordinary person in the realm of desire or a person who is established in the result is not accompanied by the faculty of understanding all that is not known.

original: de bzhin du kun shes pa'i dbang po dang kun shes ldan pa'i dbang po yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun shes pa'i dbang po dang kun shes ldan pa'i dbang po yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the faculty of understanding and the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs rnams su ji skad bshad pa ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs rnams su ji skad bshad pa ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that in the situation where there is no prohibition, one is accompanied by the faculties as explained.

original: mo yi dbang sogs ldan brgyad dang // gdon mi za bar ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mo yi dbang sogs ldan brgyad dang // gdon mi za bar ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: One is definitely accompanied by eight faculties, beginning with the female faculty.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i bdun po de dag dang ldan no //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i bdun po de dag dang ldan no //
translated: One is accompanied by the seven faculties that have just been explained.

original: lhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod mi ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod mi ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: One may or may not be accompanied by the remaining faculties.

original: de la mig la sogs pa rnams dang ni ma thob pa dang nyams pa dag mi ldan no //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa rnams dang ni ma thob pa dang nyams pa dag mi ldan no //
translated: Those who are not born as males, or who have lost their male organ, are not accompanied by the male faculty.

original: de bzhin du pho'i dbang po dang yid mi bde ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba mi ldan pa la sogs pa lhag ma snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du pho'i dbang po dang yid mi bde ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba mi ldan pa la sogs pa lhag ma snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Those who are detached are not accompanied by the faculty of dissatisfaction, etc.

original: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs rnams su ji skad bshad pa ldan par rig par bya'o //üîΩgang zhig pho'i dbang po'am /üîΩyid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi @174a * //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs rnams su ji skad bshad pa ldan par rig par bya'o // gang zhig pho'i dbang po'am / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi @174a * //
translated: In the other cases, when the texts do not specify, one should understand that the persons are accompanied by the faculties as described above.üîΩThose who are accompanied by the male faculty are necessarily accompanied by eight faculties.

original: za bar dbang po brgyad dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: za bar dbang po brgyad dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Those who are accompanied by the faculty of dissatisfaction are necessarily accompanied by eight faculties.üîΩThose who are accompanied by the faculty of dissatisfaction are necessarily accompanied by five sensations, the vitality faculty, the mental faculty, and the faculty of dissatisfaction.üîΩThe rest is as above.

original: ji skad bshad pa bdun dang / brgyad pa pho'i dbang po 'am yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa bdun dang / brgyad pa pho'i dbang po 'am yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: Those who are accompanied by the faculty of dissatisfaction are necessarily accompanied by eight faculties.

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshor ba lnga dang / lus dang / srog dang yid dang ldan te //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshor ba lnga dang / lus dang / srog dang yid dang ldan te //
translated: Those who are accompanied by the faculty of dissatisfaction are necessarily accompanied by five sensations, the vitality faculty, the mental faculty, and the faculty of dissatisfaction.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩgang zhig dad pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po brgyad dang ldan te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / gang zhig dad pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po brgyad dang ldan te /
translated: Those who possess faith and so on possess eight faculties.üîΩThose who possess the faculty of faith definitely possess eight faculties:

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni btang snyoms la sogs pa dag med par mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni btang snyoms la sogs pa dag med par mi 'byung zhing /
translated: the five such as faith, the faculties of pleasure, mind and life force.

original: de bzhin du phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not occur without equanimity and so on, and because they do not occur without each other.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste lnga po de dag dang / btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dag dang ldan no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste lnga po de dag dang / btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dag dang ldan no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said that they possess five faculties such as faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration and wisdom, and also equanimity, life force and mind.

original: de bzhin du re re brtson 'grus la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du re re brtson 'grus la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, those who possess each of the faculties of effort and so on should be described.

original: lhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod mi ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod mi ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: They may or may not possess the remaining faculties.

original: kun shes kun shes ldan pa yi //
analyzed: kun shes kun shes ldan pa yi //
translated: Those possessing complete knowledge possess eleven.

original: dbang po ldan pa bcu gcig ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po ldan pa bcu gcig ldan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eleven faculties are possessed by one endowed with faculties.

original: dbang po ldan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa la zhes re re dang sbrel bar bya'o //üîΩkun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po kho na la kun shes pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: dbang po ldan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa la zhes re re dang sbrel bar bya'o // kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po kho na la kun shes pa zhes brjod de /
translated: The term ‚Äúendowed with faculties‚Äù should be connected with each of the terms ‚Äúendowed with the faculty of understanding‚Äù and ‚Äúendowed with the faculty of the possession of complete knowledge.‚Äù

original: de ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //üîΩkun 'byung spangs so //üîΩ'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes so // kun 'byung spangs so // 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: The faculty of the possession of complete knowledge is called ‚Äúcomplete knowledge‚Äù because it is the complete knowledge of the four truths.

original: lam bsgoms so snyam du bden pa bzhi kun nas shes pa yin pas kun shes pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: lam bsgoms so snyam du bden pa bzhi kun nas shes pa yin pas kun shes pa zhes bshad de /
translated: It is complete knowledge because one thinks, ‚ÄúI have completely known suffering, abandoned origin, manifested cessation, and cultivated the path.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: kun shes pa la dbang byed pas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //üîΩgang zhig kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: kun shes pa la dbang byed pas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //üîΩgang zhig kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: the faculty of the possession of complete knowledge is so called because it controls complete knowledge.üîΩThe faculty of complete knowledge is so called because it is the complete knowledge of the four truths.üîΩThe faculty of the possession of complete knowledge is so called because it controls complete knowledge.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ni slob pa khams gsum du skyes pa yang ldan pa srid /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ni slob pa khams gsum du skyes pa yang ldan pa srid /
translated: The faculty of complete knowledge is possessed by learners born in the three realms who are on the path of meditation.

original: do ; / bcu gcig ma gtogs pa rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod /üîΩmi ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: do ; / bcu gcig ma gtogs pa rnams dang ni ldan pa yang yod / mi ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: They may or may not possess the other eleven faculties.

original: de la mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs med pa'i khams su bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba mi ldan no //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams su yang ma thob pa dang nyams pa mi ldan no //üîΩlus kyi dbang @174b po dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i slob ba mi ldan no //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs med pa'i khams su bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba mi ldan no // 'dod pa'i khams su yang ma thob pa dang nyams pa mi ldan no // lus kyi dbang @174b po dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i slob ba mi ldan no //
translated: They do not possess the eye faculty and so on, because they are born in the formless realm and they do not possess the formless realm because they are on the path of meditation.üîΩThey do not possess the eye faculty and so on, because they are born in the formless realm.üîΩThey do not possess the body faculty, because they are born in the formless realm.üîΩThey do not possess the female faculty, because they are nonreturners born in the formless realm.

original: mo dang pho'i dbang po dang ni gzugs med par skyes pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba dang 'dod pa'i khams su yang ma thob pa dang nyams pa dag bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams mi ldan no //
analyzed: mo dang pho'i dbang po dang ni gzugs med par skyes pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba dang 'dod pa'i khams su yang ma thob pa dang nyams pa dag bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams mi ldan no //
translated: They do not possess the male faculty, because they are nonreturners born in the formless realm and because they are learners on the path of meditation who have not obtained or have degenerated from the male faculty in the desire realm.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams mi ldan no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams mi ldan no //
translated: The faculty of pain is not possessed by ƒÅryas born in the form and formless realms.

original: yid mi bde ba dang ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams mi ldan no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams mi ldan no //
translated: The faculty of mental dissatisfaction is not possessed by those free of attachment to the desire realm.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang yang mi ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang yang mi ldan pa nyid do //
translated: The faculty producing complete knowledge and the faculty possessing complete knowledge are not possessed.

original: de dag mthong ba dang mi slob pa'i lam nyid de bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs su yang de bzhin du kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa rgyas par ji ltar srid pa bzhin brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag mthong ba dang mi slob pa'i lam nyid de bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs su yang de bzhin du kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa rgyas par ji ltar srid pa bzhin brjod par bya ste /
translated: Those possessing the faculty of producing complete knowledge and the faculty possessing complete knowledge should be described in detail according to the circumstances of the path of meditation, just as they are on the path of seeing and the path of no learning.

original: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs su ji skad bshad pa ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs su ji skad bshad pa ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood to possess those faculties not specifically prohibited.

original: kun shes byed pa'i dbang ldan la //
analyzed: kun shes byed pa'i dbang ldan la //
translated: One possessing the faculty producing complete knowledge

original: bcu gsum dag dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: bcu gsum dag dang ldan pa yin //
translated: possesses thirteen.

original: nges par zhes bya ba 'jug ste /
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba 'jug ste /
translated: The term definitely is supplied.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar yin te /

analyzed: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs rnams su ldan par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de la thob pa dang ma nyams pa ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang ldan no //

analyzed: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag dang kun shes pa dang kun shes ldan pa'i dbang po dag mi ldan pa nyid do //

analyzed: de dag dang 'brel ba'i phyir mo dang pho'i dbang po dang las gang yang rung ba zhig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i brgal ba'i tshig brjod par mi bya ste 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: res 'ga' rim gyis 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su pho dang mo'i dbang po 'gag kyang /

original: pa mi 'gag pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: pa mi 'gag pa'i phyir ro /

analyzed: tshor ba ni myong ba'i mtshan nyid can no //

original: zhes rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas so //
analyzed: zhes rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas so //

analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams kyang mtshan nyid tha dad mod kyi skye ba ni ma yin pas 'dir 'dus ma byas mi gzung ngo //

analyzed: nges par lhan cig skye ba yang yod ces bya ba la kha cig lhan cig skye ba yod kyi nges par lhan cig skye ba ni ma yin te / dper na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang mig la sogs pa dag lta bu ste mig la sogs pa dag ni rten /
translated: There are also factors that are produced together, but not necessarily simultaneously.üîΩFor example, the visual consciousness, etc., and the eye, etc., are produced together, but not necessarily simultaneously.

original: ba dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye, etc., are the support of the visual consciousness, etc., and are of the same nature as the latter.

original: de'i phyir nges pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges pa smos so //

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la /

original: rnam pa du ma yod kyang mdor bsdus pa brjod par 'dod na lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa du ma yod kyang mdor bsdus pa brjod par 'dod na lngar 'gyur ro //

original: ji ltar zhe na chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: @176b de la gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la rnam pa bzhir dbye ba byas te lngar 'gyur ro //

original: yang ci'i phyir rnam pa lngar bstan ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rnam pa lngar bstan ce na /

original: log par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: log par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir te /

original: gzugs la sogs par rtogs pa de dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa tha dad par bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par rtogs pa de dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa tha dad par bshad do //

original: sems dang sems las byung ba don gzhan ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba don gzhan ma yin no snyam pa la /

original: sems dang sems byung des lhan cig / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung des lhan cig / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind and mental factors are concomitant.

original: thob pa la sogs pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin no snyam pa la /üîΩmi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pa la sogs pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin no snyam pa la / mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The idea that attainment and so on do not exist is refuted by the statement:üîΩNonassociated compositional factors.

original: 'dus ma byas rdzas ma yin no snyam pa la /üîΩbral ba blo yis zad pa yin //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rdzas ma yin no snyam pa la / bral ba blo yis zad pa yin //
translated: The idea that unconditioned states are not substantial is refuted by the statement:

original: zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes 'chad do //
translated: Freedom is the exhaustion of the mind.

original: de ltar na bstan pa 'dis ni log par rtog pa de rnams bkag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na bstan pa 'dis ni log par rtog pa de rnams bkag par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus this teaching refutes those wrong ideas.

original: rang gi grub mtha' yang gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi grub mtha' yang gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'byung ste /

original: de la nges par lhan cig skye ba bsam pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la nges par lhan cig skye ba bsam pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In that regard, there is no occasion to consider arising simultaneously.

original: chos gzugs can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos gzugs can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for conditioned phenomena,

original: chos gzugs can rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos gzugs can rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: conditioned phenomena are of two types:

original: dbang po med pa rdul phra rab ces bya ba dang / rdul phra rab ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po med pa rdul phra rab ces bya ba dang / rdul phra rab ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: those without faculties, called ‚Äúatoms,‚Äù and those not called ‚Äúatoms.‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those called ‚Äúatoms‚Äù are also of two types:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams so //

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those that are objects of the desire realm are also of two types:

original: dbang po med pa rnams dang dbang po dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po med pa rnams dang dbang po dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: those without faculties and those with faculties.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rnam pa gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rnam pa gnyis kho na'o //

original: nges pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba thams cad 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba thams cad 'phen pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty: this is the introduction to all that will be explained.üîΩFirst, in the desire realm, a subtle particle is eight substances,

original: de la re zhig /'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //üîΩces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la re zhig /'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad // ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //

original: thams cad pas phra ba bsags pa'i gzugs ni rdul phra rab ces bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad pas phra ba bsags pa'i gzugs ni rdul phra rab ces bya ste zhes bya ba la /

original: rdul phra rab ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of subtle particles:

original: rdzas kyi rdul phra rab dang / bsags pa'i rdul phra rab bo //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rdul phra rab dang / bsags pa'i rdul phra rab bo //
translated: substantial subtle particles and accumulated subtle particles.

original: de la rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ni thams cad pas phra ba thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi yan lag ste /üîΩgang zhig gzugs gzhan nam /
analyzed: de la rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ni thams cad pas phra ba thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi yan lag ste / gang zhig gzugs gzhan nam /
translated: A substantial subtle particle is the smallest part of impeded form.üîΩIt is that which cannot be divided by another form

original: blos kyang rab tu rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: blos kyang rab tu rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: or by the mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de la @177a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de la @177a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: cha shas med pas de la gzugs kyi mtha' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: cha shas med pas de la gzugs kyi mtha' zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called the limit of form because it is partless.

original: skad cig ma phyed med pas skad cig ma dus kyi mtha' yin pa bzhin no //üîΩ'dus pa'i rdul phra rab ni gang las ches phra ba'i 'dus pa gzhan med pa tshogs pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyed med pas skad cig ma dus kyi mtha' yin pa bzhin no // 'dus pa'i rdul phra rab ni gang las ches phra ba'i 'dus pa gzhan med pa tshogs pa'i yan lag ste /

original: gzugs gzhan gyis gzhom par mi nus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs gzhan gyis gzhom par mi nus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the part of the composite that cannot be destroyed by any other material form.

original: gal te 'dus pa'i rdzas yin pa'i phyir skye ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus pa'i rdzas yin pa'i phyir skye ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /

original: 'dus pa skye'o zhes de skad smra /
analyzed: 'dus pa skye'o zhes de skad smra /

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na dbang po dang sgra'i rdul phra rab ma gtogs pa rdzas brgyad phan tshun 'brel pa med pa skye'o //
translated: In the realm of desire, the eight substances, with the exception of the atom of the organ of touch and the atom of sound, are produced without mutual contact.

original: 'di skad du rdzas brgyad skye'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du rdzas brgyad skye'o //
translated: We are saying that the eight substances are produced,

analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'dod pa smos pa ni gzugs kyi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: de na dri dang ro med pas rnam pa gzhan du nges par skye bar rnam par gzhag go //

original: lus dbang ldan la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus dbang ldan la zhes bya ba la /

original: rdul phra rab dang sbyar te 'khor ba can bzhin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dang sbyar te 'khor ba can bzhin no //

analyzed: de ni rdzas dgu nges par lhan cig skye ste ;

analyzed: lus kyi dbang po ni mig la sogs pa ma gtogs par yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

analyzed: de la dbang po med pa ni dgu pa'o //

original: sgra ni 'byung ba brdeg pa las skyes pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: sgra ni 'byung ba brdeg pa las skyes pa'i phyir na /

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dus pa kha cig kho na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If you think that the individual elements are not distinct,üîΩbut the collection of all the elements is distinct, then the individual elements would not be perceived, but the collection of all the elements would be perceived.üîΩIf you think that the individual elements are not distinct,

translated: If you think that the individual elements are not distinct,üîΩbut the collection of all the elements is distinct, then the individual elements would not be perceived, but the collection of all the elements would be perceived.

analyzed: gang zhig gang na ches gsal ba'i //
translated: If you think that the individual elements are not distinct,üîΩbut the collection of all the elements is distinct, then the individual elements would not be perceived, but the collection of all the elements would be perceived.

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so // ji ltar zhe na bshad pa /

original: mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba ste /
analyzed: mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba ste /
translated: If you think that the individual elements are not distinct,üîΩbut the collection of all the elements is distinct, then the individual elements would not be perceived, but the collection of all the elements would be perceived.üîΩIf you think that the individual elements are not distinct,

original: nus pa'i sgo nas shas che ba'i rdzas te /
analyzed: nus pa'i sgo nas shas che ba'i rdzas te /
translated: but the collection of all the elements is distinct, then the individual elements would

analyzed: tshad kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not in terms of quantity.

analyzed: de ni de na dmigs te zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na der dmigs kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te bya ba shas che ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
