translated: But it is not that they are not perceived because they are overwhelmed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na med pas kyang yin no zhes 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na med pas kyang yin no zhes 'dri ba ni /
translated: If that is so, then why is it asked:

original: yang ji ltar de dag na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de dag na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is it that they exist there?

original: sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i 'dus pa dag las 'byung ba lhag ma gsum yod pa nyid du rtogs she na las kyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i 'dus pa dag las 'byung ba lhag ma gsum yod pa nyid du rtogs she na las kyi sgo nas te /
translated: How is it that the remaining three elements are understood to exist in the collection of the elements earth, water, fire, and so on, which are hard, wet, hot, and so on?

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi las so sor nges par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi las so sor nges par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: They are understood through their function, because the function of the elements is ascertained individually.

original: sdud pa dang / smin pa dang / 'phel ba'i @178a * //
analyzed: sdud pa dang / smin pa dang / 'phel ba'i @178a * //
translated: coalescence, maturation, and growth.

original: bdag nyid can ni 'dzin pa la sogs las su grub ces bya bas gong kho nar bshad zin to //
analyzed: bdag nyid can ni 'dzin pa la sogs las su grub ces bya bas gong kho nar bshad zin to //
translated: The existence of the other three elements is inferred from the observation of the function of coalescence, etc.

original: de'i phyir gang na gang gi las dmigs pa de na de yod pa nyid do zhes bya bar rtogs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang na gang gi las dmigs pa de na de yod pa nyid do zhes bya bar rtogs te /
translated: Therefore, wherever the function of coalescence, etc., is observed, there the existence of the element of earth is inferred.

original: 'dzin pa la sogs pa las ni byed pa po la mi ltos pa'am /
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs pa las ni byed pa po la mi ltos pa'am /
translated: The function of coalescence, etc., does not depend on an agent, nor does it

original: byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: depend on any other agent.

original: de la rdo ba la sogs pa'i 'dus pa sra ba la ni /
analyzed: de la rdo ba la sogs pa'i 'dus pa sra ba la ni /
translated: In the coalescence of earth, etc., which is solidity, the existence of theüîΩother three elements, water, fire, and wind, is inferred from the observation

original: sdud pa dang / mi 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing lhung ba dag las chu dang / me dang rlung rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs la /
analyzed: sdud pa dang / mi 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing lhung ba dag las chu dang / me dang rlung rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs la /
translated: of the functions of cohesion, maturation, and growth.üîΩIn the coalescence of water, which is fluidity, the existence of the otherüîΩthree elements is inferred from the observation of the functions of support,

original: 'dus pa gsher ba la ni gru la sogs pa rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dro ba'i phyir dang / g-yo ba'i phyir lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: 'dus pa gsher ba la ni gru la sogs pa rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dro ba'i phyir dang / g-yo ba'i phyir lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: heating, and movement.

original: mes 'dus pa dro ba la me lce rnams brtan pa dang / bsdus pa dang / g-yo ba las lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: mes 'dus pa dro ba la me lce rnams brtan pa dang / bsdus pa dang / g-yo ba las lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: and by fire, the heat of the composite, one understands the existence of the other elements in the flame, namely, solidity, fluidity, and motion.

original: rlung gis 'dus pa g-yo ba la 'dzin pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba dang / dmigs pa las lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: rlung gis 'dus pa g-yo ba la 'dzin pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba dang / dmigs pa las lhag ma rnams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: and by wind, the motion of the composite, one understands the existence of the other elements in the wind, namely, solidity, fluidity, heat, and objective reference.

original: rkyen dang phrad na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩme la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na zangs la sogs pa rnams gsher bar dmigs pa'i phyir de la chu'i khams yod par khong du chud la /
analyzed: rkyen dang phrad na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / me la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na zangs la sogs pa rnams gsher bar dmigs pa'i phyir de la chu'i khams yod par khong du chud la /
translated: When the conditions are present,üîΩWhen the conditions of fire, etc., are present, one understands that the element of water exists in copper, etc., because one perceives fluidity.

original: grang ba la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad pas gsher ba la sra ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir de la sa'i khams yod pa nyid du nges so //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad pas gsher ba la sra ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir de la sa'i khams yod pa nyid du nges so //
translated: And when the conditions of cold, etc., are present, one understands that the element of earth exists in water, because one perceives solidity, etc.

original: de bzhin du sra ba'i tshogs drug pa las dro ba dmigs pa'i phyir me yod pa nyid dang / mngon par brdegs pa las yin lag byer ba las rlung gi khams yod pa nyid du shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sra ba'i tshogs drug pa las dro ba dmigs pa'i phyir me yod pa nyid dang / mngon par brdegs pa las yin lag byer ba las rlung gi khams yod pa nyid du shes so //
translated: Similarly, the existence of fire is inferred from the observation of heat in the sixfold collection of elements that is solid, and the existence of the wind element is known from the observation of lightness.

original: yod pa nyid ni rkyen gyi mthu'i sgo nas bya ba shas che ba nyid du byed kyi /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni rkyen gyi mthu'i sgo nas bya ba shas che ba nyid du byed kyi /
translated: The existence of these elements is due to the predominance of their function through the power of conditions.

original: med pa skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But they do not arise from nonexistence,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:üîΩIn water, it is due to the difference in cold.

original: chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len yin te /
analyzed: chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len yin te /
translated: This is the opinion of the master Haribhadra,

original: me chung ches pa dang / ches chung ba dang / chung ba dang 'dres pa'i phyir chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: me chung ches pa dang / ches chung ba dang / chung ba dang 'dres pa'i phyir chu dag la grang ba'i khyad par te /
translated: because in water there is a difference in cold due to the difference in the degree of heat,

original: grang ba dang / ches grang ba dang / grang ches ba zhes bya ba rung ste /
analyzed: grang ba dang / ches grang ba dang / grang ches ba zhes bya ba rung ste /
translated: that is, very hot, hot, and warm.

original: grang ba ni dro ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: grang ba ni dro ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Cold is the antidote to heat.

original: dngos po rnams mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa nyid las ches zhan pa dang / zhan ches pa la sogs par tha @178b dad do zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa nyid las ches zhan pa dang / zhan ches pa la sogs par tha @178b dad do zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not definite that things are different in terms of being weak, very weak, and so on due to being mixed with discordant factors.

original: ma 'dres kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Even if they are not mixed,

original: ji ltar sgra rdzas gzhan dang 'dres ba med cing rang gi rigs las ma 'das pa gsal ba dang / ches gsal ba dang / gsal ches pa yin pa dang / de bzhin du ;
analyzed: ji ltar sgra rdzas gzhan dang 'dres ba med cing rang gi rigs las ma 'das pa gsal ba dang / ches gsal ba dang / gsal ches pa yin pa dang / de bzhin du ;
translated: just as sound is not mixed with other substances, does not transcend its type, and is clear, very clear, and extremely clear,

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal cig car srid pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal cig car srid pa med mod kyi /
translated: and just as it is impossible for pleasure and pain to exist simultaneously,

original: 'on kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das par tshor ba la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir na tshor ba bde ba /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das par tshor ba la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir na tshor ba bde ba /
translated: still, since one sees a difference in feeling that does not transcend its type, there is the feeling of pleasure.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal dang 'dres pa la bltos pa med la /
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal dang 'dres pa la bltos pa med la /
translated: The feeling of pleasure does not depend on the feeling of pain.

original: sdug bsngal tshor ba dang 'dres pa la sogs pa la bltos pa med pa de bzhin du chu dag la yang rdzas gzhan dang 'dres pa med cing rang gi rigs las ma 'das par grang ba khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tshor ba dang 'dres pa la sogs pa la bltos pa med pa de bzhin du chu dag la yang rdzas gzhan dang 'dres pa med cing rang gi rigs las ma 'das par grang ba khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the feeling of pain is not dependent on the mixing of other substances, so too the cold is distinguished in water, without the mixing of other substances, and without exceeding its own type.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag la de dag sa bon gyi sgo nas yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag la de dag sa bon gyi sgo nas yod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Others say: They exist in the form of seeds in those, etc.

original: sa bon gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sa bon gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: In the form of seeds means in the form of potency.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni sra ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni sra ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dag la'o //
translated: In those means in the collections of solidity, etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni sa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Those means earth, etc.

original: rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rdzas su ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rdzas su ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: Not in their own nature means not substantially.

original: ci'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why not in their own nature?

original: de'i phyir shing gi phung po 'di la khams rnam pa sna tshogs yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shing gi phung po 'di la khams rnam pa sna tshogs yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says: In this mass of wood, various constituents exist.

original: sa bon rnams zhes bya bar rtogs kyi gser la sogs pa'i khams rnams rang gi ngo bos gnas pa ni ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon rnams zhes bya bar rtogs kyi gser la sogs pa'i khams rnams rang gi ngo bos gnas pa ni ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The seeds are understood to be the elements of gold, etc., but the elements of gold, etc., do not exist by intrinsic reality because that is contradictory.

original: shing gi phung po'i cha shas chung yang bsam gtan pa du ma'i mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing gi phung po'i cha shas chung yang bsam gtan pa du ma'i mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the parts of a pile of wood are small, the contemplations of many contemplatives are different.

original: gal te rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad pa nges par lhan cig skye na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad pa nges par lhan cig skye na /
translated: If the atom is definitely generated simultaneously with eight substances,

original: rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod ces pa'am /
analyzed: rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod ces pa'am /
translated: how can color exist in the wind?

original: yang na gsher ba nyid la sogs pa rkyen yod na sra ba la sogs pa rnams la gsher ba nyid la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir sngar yang de yod pa nyid du smras na /
analyzed: yang na gsher ba nyid la sogs pa rkyen yod na sra ba la sogs pa rnams la gsher ba nyid la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir sngar yang de yod pa nyid du smras na /
translated: Or, if you say that solidity, etc., exist previously because wetness, etc., are perceived in the conditions of wetness, etc.,

original: gang dang 'brel pa las rlung la kha dog dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rkyen ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang 'brel pa las rlung la kha dog dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rkyen ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then how can you say that color exists in the wind, since no conditions exist from which color in the wind could be perceived?

original: de'i phyir rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, you must explain how color exists in the wind.

original: don 'di ni dad par bya ba yin gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: don 'di ni dad par bya ba yin gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: This matter is to be believed, but it is not to be inferred.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rtogs te /üîΩrjes su dpag pa dang @179a * //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rtogs te / rjes su dpag pa dang @179a * //
translated: An object that is hidden is understood in two ways:üîΩby inference

original: yid ches pa'i lung gis so //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gis so //
translated: and by a trustworthy scripture.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni bshad ma thag pa'i rjes su dpag pa mi srid kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni bshad ma thag pa'i rjes su dpag pa mi srid kyi /
translated: Therefore, this matter is not possible to infer as just explained.

original: yid ches pa'i tshig tshad ma nyid du gyur pa kho na las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshig tshad ma nyid du gyur pa kho na las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It is to be understood only from a trustworthy scripture that is a valid means of knowledge.

original: don 'di ni mchog tu yid ches pa dag gis so zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: don 'di ni mchog tu yid ches pa dag gis so zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This matter is to be understood by those who have supreme trust.

original: don 'di rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don 'di rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This matter is not to be established by inference.

original: yang na dad par bya ba yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de //
analyzed: yang na dad par bya ba yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de //
translated: Or, it is not only to be believed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang yin no //
translated: It is also to be inferred.

original: 'dres par dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dres par dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is apprehended as mixed.

original: dri dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang 'dres pas rlung gis dri khrid nas 'ong pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dri 'ongs pa las kyang kha dog 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang 'dres pas rlung gis dri khrid nas 'ong pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dri 'ongs pa las kyang kha dog 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because odor is carried by the wind and the wind is mixed with a substance that possesses odor; because odor is grasped; and because color is not confused with the odor that arrives.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi khams la dri 'khrul gyi dri ni gzugs la ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi khams la dri 'khrul gyi dri ni gzugs la ma yin te /
translated: Color is confused with the element of odor in the realm of form, but odor is not confused with color.

original: de'i phyir gang na dri yod pa de na gzugs yod do zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang na dri yod pa de na gzugs yod do zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that where there is odor, there is color.

original: rdzas drug dang / bdun dang ; brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas drug dang / bdun dang ; brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who possess six, seven, or eight real entities.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro gnyis med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro gnyis med de /
translated: In the realm of form, there is neither odor nor taste.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dang / sgra dang bral ba ni rdzas drug dang ldan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dang / sgra dang bral ba ni rdzas drug dang ldan no //
translated: Therefore, those who are devoid of the faculties of nose and tongue and sound possess six real entities.

original: lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas bdun dang ldan no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa ni rdzas bdun dang ldan no //
translated: Those who possess the body faculty possess seven real entities.

original: dbang po gzhan dang ldan pa ni rdzas brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan dang ldan pa ni rdzas brgyad pa yin no //
translated: Those who possess another faculty possess eight real entities.

original: de dag sgra dang bcas na ni rdzas bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang ldan no //
analyzed: de dag sgra dang bcas na ni rdzas bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang ldan no //
translated: If they are accompanied by sound, they are endowed with seven, eight, or nine substances.

original: don gyis bshad zin pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: don gyis bshad zin pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because their meaning is similar to what has already been explained.

original: de bshad zin pa 'dra ba'i dngos po ni bshad zin pa 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bshad zin pa 'dra ba'i dngos po ni bshad zin pa 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: The similarity of the thing to what has already been explained is the similarity to what has already been explained.

original: brjod pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang mi bshad do //
analyzed: brjod pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang mi bshad do //
translated: It is also not explained because it would follow that the statement would be meaningless.

original: yang ci 'dir zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: yang ci 'dir zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad dang ldan par ro //
translated: Here, what is meant by here? It means that the subtle particle is endowed with eight substances.

original: rdzas kho na rdzas su gzung zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi sgras sa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na brjod kyi skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas kho na rdzas su gzung zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi sgras sa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na brjod kyi skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: Only substance is grasped as substance means that the term substance expresses only the intrinsic characteristics of earth, etc., not the intrinsic characteristics of the sense bases.

original: 'on te skye mched kyi zhes bya ba ni skye mched kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on te skye mched kyi zhes bya ba ni skye mched kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or sense base means that it is the intrinsic characteristic of the sense bases, not the intrinsic characteristic of substance.

original: gal te rdzas kho na la rdzas su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kho na la rdzas su zhes bya ba la /
translated: If only substance is meant by substance,

original: gal te rdzas kho na rdzas kyi sgras gzung gi skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kho na rdzas kyi sgras gzung gi skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin na ni /
translated: If substance alone is referred to by the term substance, and not the intrinsic identity of the sense bases,

original: de lta yin na ha cang nyung bar smra ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ha cang nyung bar smra ba yin te /
translated: then this is an extremely limited assertion,

original: rdul phra rab de la brgyad dang dgu dang bcu las tha dad pa'i @179b rdzas gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de la brgyad dang dgu dang bcu las tha dad pa'i @179b rdzas gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because there are other substances that are different from eight, nine, or ten in relation to that atom.

original: de yang rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i kha dog gi gzugs la kha dog gi rdul phra rab bsags pas rdul phra rab de la kha dog nges par yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro // bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i kha dog gi gzugs la kha dog gi rdul phra rab bsags pas rdul phra rab de la kha dog nges par yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is because it is an aggregation of atoms.üîΩSince the form of color that is an aggregation of atoms of color exists in a pot, cloth, and so on, color is definitely present in that atom.

original: de bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa la dbyibs kyi rdul phra rab kyang bsags pas na rdul phra rab de la dbyibs kyang nges par yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa la dbyibs kyi rdul phra rab kyang bsags pas na rdul phra rab de la dbyibs kyang nges par yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, since the atoms of shape that are an aggregation of atoms of shape exist in a pot, cloth, and so on, shape is definitely present in that atom.

original: lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid dag dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dag las gang yang rung ba zhig kyang nges par yod do //üîΩ'dus ba'i gzugs ni lci ba nyid dang bral ba 'am /
analyzed: lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid dag dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dag las gang yang rung ba zhig kyang nges par yod do // 'dus ba'i gzugs ni lci ba nyid dang bral ba 'am /
translated: Heavy and light, soft and coarse, cold, hunger and thirst are not necessarily found together.üîΩThere is no composite form that is not heavy,

original: 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid dang bral ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid dang bral ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: or that is not soft or coarse.
